Assist sales team with updating of Customer Relationship Management tools. Provide support on presentation development for agents, groups and leadership. Lead the coordination of the numerous ad-hoc requests, across the entire sales team. Responsible for assisting and supporting management in the evaluation, recommendation, establishment, implementation and analysis of market, membership, financial and prospect information.Identify, plan, develop, modify and implement new or existing reports as assigned. Analyze data and information; plan, design and implement analytical projects and studies of the sales and financial markets. Conduct membership trend analysis and ongoing competitive assessment of various business and market segments, customers, prospects, providers and competitors to identify opportunities and threats. Coordinate and provide technical support for membership forecasting, sales planning and sales incentive program. Responsive for qualifying new and existing businesses prospects for BCBSM health care coverage.Other duties may be assigned.Bachelor's Degree in Business, Mathematics, Information Systems or related area preferred.Two (2) years experience in an analytical, research or management information position in service, health or sales related industry required. Project planning and familiarity with the client server environment preferredKnowledge of competitors, health care pricing and product development, market research methods and techniques, statistical analysis and market planning.Knowledge and use of existing software packages.Strong problem solving, presentation, analytical and communication skills.Other related skills and/or abilities may be required to perform this job.DEPARTMENT REQUIREMENTSThe ideal candidate will be exceptionally organized, strong collaboration skills and some graphic design experience.Experience with Salesforce is a plus. Degree in Marketing or related field is preferred. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to, among other grounds, race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, gender identity, protected veteran status or status as an individual with a disability.

Name: Strategy Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionJOB SUMMARYThe Strategy Analyst will assist in the development of responses for client requests and opportunities in the form of but not limited to; Requests for Information (RFIs)/ Requests for Proposal (RFPs) and energy program modeling. Experience with energy methods and procedures, technical understanding, documentation skills and familiarity with utility demand side management (i.e., DSM) and conservation programs. This position will involve research in utility and energy efficiency programs, proposal content and formal presentation creation.The Strategy Analyst creates draft versions of customer response content for management and technical review; compiles and evaluates team feedback, will work to reconcile all internal feedback. This person will also interface with subject matter experts—as well as contacts in sales, finance, legal, and business development to gather key information as needed.DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIESIdentifies and analyzes Requests for Proposals (RFPs), Requests for Quotes (RFQs), ID/IQ Task Orders, and Requests for Information (RFIs).Responsible for proposal content formatting and visual quality check of all graphic components of complex proposal documents within Microsoft Word. Includes creation of any client requested supporting documentation and/or forms.Facilitates response kickoff and structuring meetings, prepares proposal status meetings, review meetings and secures final approval for submission.Writes original content and/or edits relevant materials to create proposal components that have a cohesive written voice, and that clearly articulate both the sales messaging and technical detail of the company’s offerings.Proofreads and edits proposal text and other authors for proper grammar, spelling, comprehension and style. Name: Business Systems Analyst
Description: Business Systems Analyst  + 28636 Mound Rd, Warren, MI 48092, USA  + Full-time  + Legal Entity: Bosch Automotive Service Solutions Inc. Company Description Do you want beneficial technologies being shaped by your ideas? Whether in the areas of mobility solutions, consumer goods, industrial technology or energy and building technology ? with us, you will have the chance to improve quality of life all across the globe. Welcome to Bosch.  Position your career for long term success by joining the world's most admired motor vehicle parts supplier as ranked by Fortune for the third consecutive year. Job Description As theBusiness Systems Analyst, you will coordinate and hold responsibility for marketing systems and processes around master data [MD] in the United States. The role will have a global component to it, as expertise gained towards processes and system execution will be leveraged throughout the Bosch Automotive Service Solutions Business Unit of the Aftermarket Division.  You will work closely with Product Managers, Sales, and Engineering functions in the business unit, and Marketing counterparts both in the region and other regions of the world to create, implement, and govern processes.  Your first major project as theBusiness Systems Analystwill be helping to lead a major software implementation. The transition of legacy ERP systems to a harmonized SAP environment is a leading priority over the next two years. Your responsibilities will include: + Creation of Global Part Master Data System input processes and templates using existing operations and future state requirements as guidelines  + Train and Support for SAP migrations both inside the U.S. and outside of the U.S.  + Material establishment and maintenance of data integrity  + North American business unit representative for Master Data @ Automotive Aftermarket, which covers Product Lifecycle management, Product Information storage, and vehicle data, enabling transition to new toolset where applicable  + Lead of creation of process documentation and collection of master data, and how it is input into associated systems for use globally  + Working with Product Manager and Engineering teams to ensure the data is correctly reported for the financials  + Analyzing current and historical data for reporting and KPI?s  + Ownership of product lifecycle management process  + Collect and input Catalog Prices and Price ceiling/floor for North American saleable goods  + Lead Product Hierarchy structure changes fitting to North American strategy and operations Qualifications + BS, BA degree in Business, Engineering, Finance, or other related field.  + Minimum of 5+ years of experience  + Project Management Certified preferred  + Experience with SAP highly preferred  + Systems acumen around ERP systems and Excel required  + Strong desire to investigate current process operations and improve them  + Self-learner, ability to work both independently and lead team efforts  + Must be able to travel nationally and internationally, up to 15% travel  + Must be eligible to work in the US without VISA sponsorship.  + Not eligible for internal VA/VN international assignment. Additional Information By choice, we are committed to a diverse workforce-EOE/Protected Veteran/Disabled  Job Location

Name: Pricing Analyst
Description: At Muncie Power Products, "We Build Trust" is not just a slogan it's the way we do business. As a leading manufacturer of power take-offs and fluid power components, we've been building trust for 80 years with our reliable, quality products and dependable customer service. We want the next generation of employees to continue that legacy. As a mid-size company Muncie Power Products provides a culture that values our employees by offering professional development, wellness opportunities, and a supportive work environment.  As a pricing analyst, you are responsible for providing a consistent approach and strategic thought for the pricing of products. You will review and improve the pricing process along with developing strategic pricing recommendations to be presented to senior leadership. These objectives will be accomplished through research and analysis of competitive pricing dynamics and development of robust pricing models for MPP products and product lines. This position is located in Muncie, Indiana.Essential Duties & Responsibilities: - Conduct analysis and modeling based on key pricing inputs to develop optimal pricing recommendations Lead and direct pricing strategy formulation and take necessary pricing actions to enhance profitability, ensuring integrity and accuracy in all pricing matters.Synthesize analysis and present recommendations to senior management which maximize profitabilityIdentify and highlight key strategic considerations surrounding large pricing requests. Assist with pricing negotiations of customers' proposalsConsolidate and manage pricing knowledge over time to provide ever greater context for pricing decisionsOngoing process improvement (e.g., create repeatable process for analysis like customer adoption, win/losses, margin degradation/improvement, price realization). Perform financial evaluation to assess pricing action effectiveness.Develop pricing policies and proceduresWork collaboratively with sales leadership to support ongoing development and review of channel partner discount strategiesPartner with buyers, product managers and sales department to ensure integrated profit maximizing approach to marketManage total pricing procedure, enhance processes to make most of efficiencies and ensure timely response to market conditions.Assess financial impact of price approach in view of overall history as well as profitability of customerReview business accounts to ensure accurate pricing Education: Bachelor's degree required Experience and Skills: - 3-5 years of business to business experience working in an analytic capacityStrong business acumen with demonstrated ability to work across functional areasExcellent knowledge of MS Excel and MS PowerPoint; knowledge of Visual Basic, SQL, SPSS or an alternate statistical package preferredHighly self-motivated with a track record of taking ownershipAbility to interact with senior management; strong communication and presentation skills.Ability to synthesize information into key messages appropriate for the audienceHigh tolerance for ambiguity and an ability to work cooperatively and forge relationshipsEffective analytical, troubleshooting and problem-solving skillsDemonstrated project management skills Benefits: Muncie Power Products offers a highly competitive compensation and benefit package including Medical, Dental, Prescription, Life Insurance, Dependent Life, Accidental Death & Dismemberment (AD&D) Insurance, Short-Term Disability, Long-Term Disability, Wellness Program Incentives, Flexible Spending Account, 401(k) Plan with Company match, Employee Assistance Program, Vision, Voluntary Life with Long-Term Care, Voluntary Accident. Equal Opportunity Employer

The Technical Delivery Lead has a strategic role in facilitating and leveraging the entire lifecycle of IT investments in infrastructure and systems. Once a project is set in motion, IT Delivery lead professionals are expected to communicate major milestones, identify potential project risks, provide continuing direction to the delivery teams and communicate project status regularly. On-Call duties may include carrying a cell phone for immediate notifications.  o Work in team environments and contribute to the team performance.  o Write clearly and communicate information and ideas scenarios, business analysis, task and workflow analysis.  o Critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high level information into details, abstract up from low level information to a general understanding and distinguish user requests from the underlying true needs.  o Proactively communicate and collaborate with external and internal customers to analyze information needs and functional requirements and deliver the following artifacts as needed: Functional requirements, business requirements, use cases GUI, screen and interface designs, develop, monitor and conduct application testing.  o Work independently with users to define concepts under the direction of project managers.  o Drive and challenge business units on their assumptions of how they will successfully execute their plans.  o Strong analytical skills and product management skills to be able to understand and interpret customer business needs and translate them into application and operational requirements.  o Serves as a conduit between the customer and the software development team.  o Collaborates with developers and subject matter experts to establish the technical vision and analyze trade-offs between usability and performance needs.  o Be the liaison between the business units, technology teams and support teams. Requirements: o The successful Business Analyst will have a minimum of 5 years of experience in business analysis.  o 4 year degree (Preferably Computer Science or similar)  o Knowledge of Client server technologies. Mainframe knowledge is also beneficial.  o Knowledge of Microsoft Office tools.  o Knowledge of project management methods and tools.  o Experience with Oracle, DB2 and SQL databases.  o Working knowledge of Agile practices.  o Ability to work in a matrix organization.  o Ability to establish deliverables and detail customer requirements, constraints, and assumptions with stakeholders and service providers in order to establish the deliverables for the service providers, using requirement gathering techniques.  o Ability to implement approved actions and workarounds with vendors minimizing risk. Description: The Business Analyst will manage one or more non-technical projects within the constraints of scope, quality, time, and cost, to deliver specified requirements. Responsibilities may include resource allocation and all phases of development life cycle (i.e. feasibility study, requirements, analysis, ROI, business plan, design testing, and implementation planning). Regularly interacts with management. Coordinates and directs the activities of project team members. Ensures all project requirements and/or objectives are documented. W2/ HOURLY PAY RATE: Open (based upon experience and qualifications)There is no “per diem” with this positionThere is no relocation budgeted for this position. If this position requires you to relocate you will be responsible for those costs.At this time we are not in the position to offer any type of sponsorships or VISA transfers for this position.EMAIL:petf054@kellyservices.comapply now

Name: IT Business Analyst/Project Manager
Description: Job DescriptionJob Description Softura is looking for a Business Analyst/Project Manager for our Farmington Hills, MI office. This person will be responsible for delivering software projects that require a deep understanding of the software engineering process. It is important that this person have excellent communication and documentation skills to understand the end-user perspective and to write clear and concise business requirements. The BA/PM must be experienced managing numerous projects simultaneously, participate in business analysis and possess a strong background in technology. This is a hybrid role and responsibilities can shift throughout projects, i.e., there may be times where the position will require more PM work than BA work or vice versa. As part of a growing company and team, the role requires strong leadership and forward thinking in order to deliver valuable solutions to our clients. We recognize those who are results-oriented, have a strong sense of responsibility, take ownership of their projects and successfully manage multiple tasks in a rapidly changing environment. ResponsibilitiesDefine Solutions & Document RequirementsGather business requirements via proactive communication and collaboration with partners, clients, industry and internal experts.Understand the business processes and need in software development projectsDocument business requirements and specifications, including functional and non-functional requirements, flow charts, process descriptions, user cases, user stories, acceptance criteria and data specificationsAssist the testing team in developing test cases, reviewing them and signing off on the final outcomeWork with technical architects who have responsibility to design solutions that meet the requirements. Collaborate with business and technical resources internally and externally to achieve the solutionServe as the conduit between the client stakeholders and the software development team, including the offshore development team.Deliver SolutionsEnsure the on-time release of deliverables by coordinating schedules with development teams, Softura partners and clients. Development teams may include offshore project managers, development managers, technical lead, developers and QACoordinate deliverables into requirements road-maps and technical solution road-mapsCoordinate User Acceptance Testing (UAT) and manage the feedback from the clientReport on key metrics of a project to internal stakeholders and client key stakeholdersMaintain and prioritize the product backlog as per business value and needsManage project schedule and Work Breakdown Structure, create and update Requirements Traceability Matrix, track and report hours spent against estimates, review and approve time sheets, track project completion, projects risks, project funds and provide a weekly project update to internal and external stakeholdersManage enhancement and change requests, estimate added efforts and execute change orders in a timely mannerRequired QualificationsBachelor’s Degree in Business or Computer Science5-7 years of experience as a Business Analyst/Project Manager developing business requirements, process flows, and program charters and/or statements of workExperience running client meetings for gathering requirements, managing projects, collaborating on solutions and resolving issuesExcellent verbal and written communication skills, including ability to effectively communicate with internal teams and external customers, technical and non-technical staff, stakeholders, and development teamsExcellent teamwork skillsA strong background in technology, analysis and critical evaluation of information gathered from multiple sourcesAbility to understand technology and business process and how the two are dependent upon one another for solution deliveryPrepare and communicate status reports to team and managementElicit business requirements from key stakeholders by using interviews, document analysis requirements workshops, task and workflow analysisExcellent computer proficiency (MS Office Word, Excel, Visio, PowerPoint, SharePoint)Manage multiple projects from small to large scale in a cross-functional environmentAble to work independently, be a collaborative team player, excellent time management and prioritization skills, able to manage a heavy workload at times, ability to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines, while maintaining a positive attitude, and providing exemplary customer servicePreferred QualificationsMaster's degree in Business or Computer ScienceExperience with Agile software development or Scrum Master CertificationHands-on programming experience developing web or mobile applications in C#, Java, ASP.netExperience in object oriented analysis and design using UML methodology Softura provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees & applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics, and complies with all applicable Federal and State & Local laws throughout all stages of the recruiting and employment life-cycle.Company DescriptionSoftura is a leading technology consulting company with over 20 years of experience solving technology and business problems for our clients. We have a national and global footprint with over 250 employees In the United States and another 150 globally. We are uniquely positioned to provide services to organizations in multiple industries such as Finance/Banking, Manufacturing, Automotive, Transportation, Healthcare, Medical Devices, Oil/Petroleum, Retail, and others.  Softura's most important assets are our employees. We base this on three core principles: HUMAN VALUES We respect the unique needs of our employees. INTEGRITY We believe in transparency, honesty, and fairness in everything we do. INNOVATION We strive to train, mentor and develop the skills of our employees so they can realize their personal and professional goals, as well as set benchmarks in the industry. We've been known to produce the industries top technology trailblazers and thought leaders. A career growth opportunity is waiting for you at Softura.

Name: Sr Business Analyst - Health Plan Business Strategy
Company: Blue Cross Blue Shield of Michigan
Description: The Sr Business Analyst will be part of the Strategy team responsible for shaping and driving strategies for Blue Cross Blue Shield of Michigan’s (BCBSM) Health Plan Business (HPB) division. As part of the HPB Strategy team, you will work closely with market-facing segments and functional areas as a strategic adviser and partner on near-term and long-term divisional priorities and strategies (e.g., segment and functional area-specific efforts, cross-divisional initiatives, and division-led enterprise-wide efforts). Key activities include developing work plans, performing quantitative/qualitative analysis, gathering/synthesizing external perspectives (e.g., market dynamics, competitor insights, etc.), framing strategic options, and crafting deliverables. In addition, you will support the division’s strategic planning process and its key strategic forums/discussions, gaining exposure to the most important priorities of the business.Develop detailed project plans and schedules, identify goals, objectives, risks and resource allocationMonitor project status for significant deviations in quality, cost or schedule. Interface with various departments, senior management and external individuals providing value and support for continuous improvementSupport development of project budgets and update, as required. Coach and mentor team membersProvide feedback on team performanceEnsure that expectations are developed, controlled, and executed in a timely mannerRepresent leadership staff at meetings in their absence. May provide supervision to others. Other duties as assigned.Desired Experience and SkillsBachelor's Degree in related field requiredProfessional services (e.g., consulting, investment banking) or corporate strategy experience is preferredFive (5) or more years' experience in related fieldStrong technical skills (e.g., financial modeling, quantitative methods, presentation development)Exceptional analytical and quantitative problem-solving skillStrong written and oral communication skills with confidence and ability to interact effectively with senior leadersComfort with uncertainty and ability to manage multiple competing prioritiesProject management and organizational skillsLeadership and/or analytical experience with data, systems, and operationsKnowledge of program management preferredAbility to work independently, within a team environment and with multiple prioritiesProficient in current industry standard PC applications and systems Three (3) years project management experience in health plan operations or related fieldProject Management Professional Certificate preferredAbility to work closely with the technical support team in understanding and resolving systems issuesAbility to develop, implement, and monitor policies and proceduresOther related skills and/or abilities may be required to perform this jobAll qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to, among other grounds, race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, gender identity, protected veteran status or status as an individual with a disability.

Name: Oracle JD Edwards Business Analyst
Description: Job title: Oracle JD Edwards Business Analyst  Location: Southfield, MI, USA What we offer: Veoneer develops cutting-edge technology for the Future Car. Our international, agile and highly collaborative teams aim to accelerate the growth in Autonomous Driving and be the leader in Advanced Driver Assistance Systems. We empower our people and are dedicated to their professional development and growth.  With 7500 employees in 13 countries, our growing team has the goal to lead the revolution underway in the automotive industryand then be the pioneer for what comes next. What you'll do: As part of the digitization and mobile use of applications, the application landscape for Oracle JD Edwards must be aligned with the requirements of business and meet the demands of a modern technology. In this position, you'll be responsible for the lifecycle of Oracle JD Edwards and its connected components, from strategic decisions until maintenance of service. You'll manage projects in this area and oversee the external service providers Project ManagementAnalyzing application/business requirements and gives feedback with regards to feasibility, redundancies, needed interfaces, cost, parties involved, security and infrastructure requirements.Provides solution design with functional and technical conception in alignment with business requirements, architectural principles, infrastructural framework and security guidelines.Executes and controls application development, test and maintenance activities.Plans, executes and controls training activities.Plans and initiates go-live activities with regards to release planning.Optimizes continuously the application digitalization, functions, usability, performance, budget and costResponsible of entire application lifecycleProject Management servicesSupports definition of an application strategy, roadmap, business case, execution plan, sourcing and service strategy.Defining and providing entire application architecture.Managing SLA's, budget and costWhat you'll bring:Bachelor's Degree in Business, Computer Engineering or equivalent requiredDocumented Project Management skillsDocumented leader roles are highly meritedExcellent experience in Oracle JD EdwardsGood business knowledgeTechnical (i-Series) know-howSDL2017

Name: Sr Business Analyst
Description: Id: 8190 Location: Southfield, Michigan Job Type: CTH The Senior Business Analyst works with the Information Technology (IT) team and Business Analysis Manager with primary responsibility for both creating processes, templates, and methods to accomplish analysis, design, evaluation, selection, implementation and support of enterprise applications, as well as undertaking these activities on various projects. This position will partner closely with the Business, internal Corporate Services Support staff and IT to provide technical support to solve business problems, ensuring that the business has the entirety of its technology needs met. This will include resolving application integration issues and planning for the selection and implementation of new technologies to service this customer base. The Senior Business Analyst may coach more junior Business Analysts' in various ways. Responsibilities:Gathering/Documentation: Creates templates to support various methods of requirements engineering, for re-use  Determines which method for requirements elicitation will work best in each projects’ unique set of circumstances; makes recommendations for more junior BAs relative to which methods would be most effective and expedient  Supports the BA Manager and other IT areas (including Security and Operations) to create a set of standard non-functional requirements to be used on all projects  Works with internal customers to identify specific user requirements and determine system needs to assure project deliverables meet customer expectations.  Interviews employees at all levels to analyze work procedures and operational methods for the needs analysis stage of implementation. Documents current and desired processes, ensuring all documentation is kept up-to-date and communicated to the relevant stakeholders on a timely basis.  Maintains and resolves requirements issues; coaches other BAs through such situations.  Creates functional specifications for delivering customer solutions.  Assists with the development of Requests for Proposals (RFPs) and training documents. Solutions: Works with IT to deliver solutions and defining the approach for solution development and recommends business process enhancements.  Participates in the design and development/implementation of applications  Participates in problem solving in areas such as system design, input/output requirements and procedural flow between departments and/or business systems.  Testing (in absence of Quality Assurance Manager and staff):  Supports creation of templates for Test Strategy, test plans, test cases and test scripts.  Leads testing to assure quality products are delivered to ensure all processes work according to predetermined goals.  Facilitates user acceptance testing, documenting results of testing.  Resolves bugs and issues with business and IT.  Support (during post-go live / warranty period, or as otherwise assigned):  Provides technical Level 2 support to the end users of applications.  Provide technical assistance in designing reporting systems, forms and related business tools.  Monitors system integrations for accuracy and completion.  Develops and maintains systems documentation. Required Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in a related area preferred. Work experience may be acceptable.  Experience with methodologies across Waterfall and Agile.  Experience selecting, implementing, or at least working with requirements and/or PPM (project and portfolio management) tools/systems.  Minimum six (6) years of professional experience in IT technical services.  Experience in enterprise applications and understanding of database driven applications.  Experience working directly with IT and business/functional team members to understand project concept, objectives and approach.  Knowledge of computer system capabilities, business processes, work flow, and understanding of software development life cycle.  Experience with various solutions (in-house developed as well as COTS / SaaS).  Experience working with 3rd party vendors and remote resources.  Ability to work on projects requiring organizational and time-management skills.  Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, including the ability to bridge functional and technical resources by communicating effectively  Strong consultative, critical thinking and analytic skills with ability to operate independently and build effective partnerships across multiple stakeholder groups.  Self-motivated, takes initiative and can work independently.  Strong attention to detail, exceptional documentation skills, motivated/quick learner.  Ability to react to changing priorities and strong time management skills.  Must be process and detail oriented, but able to grasp the big picture.  Creative and innovative with a demonstrated track record of collaboration.  Good facility with general MS Office tools and Project Management tools is desired. Preferred Skills: CBAP or other business analysis certification preferred.

Name: Dynamics 365 CRM Business Analyst-Midwest
Description: Microsoft has heightened the importance and expectation for CRM solutions. As Microsoft's leading Dynamics CRM solution provider, Avanade combines extensive implementation expertise, leading practices, and user experience design with the strength, stability and power of Microsoft Dynamics CRM software enabling companies to maximize the business value of their CRM Solution. Across the globe and in multiple industries, Avanade helps enterprises create superior customer experiences, deepen customer relationships and maximize business agility.  About the role  CRM Business Analysis identifies and understands our clients customer relationship management needs. This involves staying current on CRM technologies (particularly Microsoft Dynamics CRM) and working with Avanade solution developers to recommend appropriate CRM technologies and functions that meet specific client needs.  As a Leader of CRM Business Analysis, you will lead teams in developing and deploying CRM solutions. You will ensure that client business requirements are met, while providing advisory services around project management, business process development, implementation support and end-user training. You will be familiar with the latest versions of Microsoft Dynamics CRM and related Independent Software Vendor (ISV) products.  Day-to-day, you will:  Work with Avanade delivery teams and client stakeholders to translate business  requirements into CRM solutions  Work with client leadership, end users and IT staff to identify, design and configure CRM solutions  Work with stakeholders to gather system requirements and own requirements management  Lead transfer of functional requirements to development and test teams  Determine needed patches and upgrades in collaboration with business and IT stakeholders  Educate end users on CRM functionality.QualificationsAbout you  You are a CRM wizard and motivational leader. Someone who is adept at understanding client business needs, translating them into technology specifics and leading teams to build finished solutions. You are likely a big-picture thinker and detail-oriented doer.  Your technical skills include:  Extensive knowledge of CRM systems and business solution implementations  Demonstrable experience in business process reengineering  Knowledge of CRM issue diagnosis and troubleshooting.  Your business skills include:  Experience consulting on complex projects and taking leadership role  Experience working with global teamsespecially offshore teamsto implement and maintain CRM systems  Demonstrated excellence in communicating and presenting complex information to technical and non-technical stakeholders, both orally and in writing.  You likely have at least five years of experience in business systems analysis, design or management and at least three years managing teams comprised of business and technical staff. Your education likely includes a Bachelors degree in a relevant field, preferably computer science, business administration, finance or information technology.  About Avanade  Avanade leads in providing innovative digital services, business solutions and design-led experiences for its clients, delivered through the power of people and the Microsoft ecosystem. Our professionals combine technology, business and industry expertise to build and deploy solutions to realize results for clients and their customers. Avanade has 27,000 digitally connected people across 23 countries, bringing clients the best thinking through a collaborative culture that honors diversity and reflects the communities in which we operate. Majority owned by Accenture, Avanade was founded in 2000 by Accenture LLP and Microsoft Corporation. Learn more at www.avanade.com.  Avanade® Is An Equal Opportunity Employer. Avanade prohibits discrimination and harassment against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, age, religion, sex, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, disability, veteran, military or marital status, genetic information or a Requisition ID - 57823 Avanade is the leading provider of innovative digital and cloud-enabling services, business solutions and design-led experiences, delivered through the power of people and the Microsoft ecosystem. Majority owned by Accenture, Avanade was founded in 2000 by Accenture LLP and Microsoft Corporation and has 30,000 professionals in 24 countries. Visit us at www.avanade.com.

Name: HEDIS Business Analyst
Description: Overview Who we are: Meridian Health Plan is a family-owned, family-operated company of passionate leaders, achievers, and innovators dedicated to making a difference in the lives of our members, our providers and in the healthcare industry.  We provide government-based health plans (Medicare, Medicaid, and the Health Insurance Marketplace) in five different states (Michigan, Illinois, Indiana, Kentucky, and Ohio).  Our employees work hard, play hard, and give back. Meridian employees enjoy: Happy hours, special events, company sports teams, potlucks, Bagel Fridays, weekly Executive Lunches, and volunteer opportunities. A Day in the Life of a Business Analyst: The Business Analyst position is primarily responsible for requirements gathering, requirements analysis, impact assessment, and creation of Business Requirements documents and Functional Specifications for system development projects of various size and complexity. The Business Requirement documents are at a detailed level, including related functional requirements, use cases, testing considerations and functional solution design. This position collaborates with Business Leads and subject matter experts, Delivery Leads, Architects, vendors, and technical resources on a regular basis throughout the project delivery lifecycle. The Business Analyst 2 is responsible for adhering to corporate software development standards and methodologies. Secondary responsibilities include creation and maintenance of various types of documents, testing support, issue investigation, analysis, and resolution, and assisting in responding to new corporate initiatives and work requests as needed. ResponsibilitiesCollaborate with the business units and/or external clients in the definition and documentation of project scope, and identification and documentation of project risks and assumptionsParticipates in the work estimation processPerforms business process analysis and process modeling and participates in the development of strategies for process enhancementsSolicits and documents business and functional requirements and additional artifacts such as Use Cases to define client needs/wantsPerforms data mining and data analysis as needed for research and to support the development of required artifactsManages business requirements documents throughout all project phases and ensures departmental compliance with audit-required processesParticipates in architecting the logical design of system functional solutions with the developers and architects, including screen design and specifications, data modeling, and documentation of logical processing flowsResponsible for facilitating/brokering communication between the business customers and the technical teamEstablishes and maintains traceability between business and functional requirements and artifacts in accordance with department guidelinesMocks up screens per agreed-upon functional design and transfers these designs to functional specificationsCommunicates with development and QA teams regularly to ensure accurate understanding and interpretation of requirements and other produced artifacts such as functional specificationsCollaborates with QA teams in the execution of User Acceptance Testing (UAT)Assists in the preparation of user training materials based on approved functional specifications; assist or conduct training sessions as assignedParticipates in Quality Assurance testing as necessaryProvides post implementation production support including problem triage, analysis, and resolutionResearches, reviews, and analyzes existing processes; develop improvement strategiesAssists Delivery Lead in the creation and maintenance of project plans and project status reportsQualificationsWhat you can bring to Meridian:Bachelor’s degree requiredMust pass the MHP Analyst AssessmentTwo to three (2 - 3) years’ Information Technology experience as a business/systems analyst, programmer, designer, or QA Analyst requiredAt least two (2) years’ experience in large scale system implementation efforts using a standard software lifecycle methodologyProven experience with business requirements analysis, business process modeling/mapping, and impact assessment; requirements management with Use Cases desiredProven experience in client requirements/needs analysis and ability to interpret those requirements as they pertain to existing company systems/processes is requiredExperience working with data structures such as relational databases, XML, fixed length, and delimited filesData mining, analysis, definition and data mapping experienceHealth care insurance experience preferredWhat Meridian can offer you:Our healthcare benefits include a variety of PPO plans that are effective on the first day of employment for our new full-time team members.Opportunity to work with the industry’s leading technologies and participate in unique projects, demonstrations, conferences, and exclusive learning opportunities.Meridian offers 401k matching that is above the national average.Full-time MHP employees are eligible for tuition reimbursement towards Bachelor’s or Master’s degrees.Meridian Health Plan was named Detroit's #1 Fastest Growing Company by Crain's Magazine, so it is a great time to get involved with Meridian.EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER#MSTR

Name: Charge Description Master Analyst
Description: GENERAL SUMMARY:Reporting to the CDM Manager, the CDM Analyst is responsible for supporting and maintaining the Charge Description Master (CDM), including being responsible for the accuracy and completeness of the CDM. The CDM Analyst also supports the CDM Coordinator and Senior CDM Analysts. Areas of responsibility include: PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:1. Reviews and/or processes changes, addition and deletion requests for CDM updates. 2. Follows HELIOS required change control processes for all updates/changes needed. 3. Participates in CAB call for Service Now Tickets submitted by Clinical and/or Operational departments. Routes/assigns Service Now tickets to responsible CDM team members based on assigned departments. 4. Serves as technical resource for assigned clinical or business departments throughout HFHS. Responsibility includes, but is not limited to, the assessment of optimization efforts to meet system goals including patient safety, quality of care, charge capture and improving operational efficiencies. 5. Collaborates with EPIC Application teams, Reimbursement, Compliance, and SMEs to maintain/update/test the CDM and appropriate EAP records and their links to these records for pricing and fee schedule maintenance. 6. Supports timely implementation of coding updates (CPT/HCPCS), periodic UB Revenue Code updates, modifier revisions and regulatory updates to CDM. Assists CDM Team with communications to Clinical End Users, Revenue Integrity, Reimbursement, IT, HIM and others (as needed) when coding changes may impact net reimbursement, gross charges, productivity or internal processes. 7. Analyzes and processes charging and rate errors within EPIC Work Queues as well as other claim edit or charge review issues that occur. 8. Coordinates distribution of monthly CDM listings and reports to MedAssets and other users. Runs Jxports lists. Creates/runs other EPIC/CDM reports as needed. 9. Reviews and requests changes to preference lists (charge navigators). 10. Performs a variety of duties within EPIC including, but not limited to, creation of EAPs in POC (Proof of Concept) environment and test PB custom codes in POC or TST and updates fee schedule rates in POC for CDM Manager’s review. 11. Provides quality control check and audits that expected CDM changes have properly moved from test into the production environment. 12. With the CDM Manager and CDM Coordinator, collaborates with appropriate HELIOS application team or Subject Matter Experts (SME) to maintain the various table files for providing accurate CPT/HCPCS and revenue codes within EPIC which are responsible for providing accurate CPT/HCPCS codes and revenue codes based upon multiple payer requirements. 13. Adheres to HELIOS Service Level Agreements related to EPIC. 14. Analyzes legislation and regulations, reviews and interprets records, newsletters, bulletins, (billing and remittance) to comply with third party regulations. This includes knowledge of Medicare/Medicaid regulations as well as understanding of managed care contracts. 15. Actively participates in ongoing monitoring process to identify billing problems related to the CDM to include: evaluation of the accuracy of interface functionality, quarterly audit of the appropriateness of UB04 formatting for major payers and confirmation of the accuracy of departmental charge capture tools (charge screens, charge sheets, etc.). 16. Participates collaboratively with Revenue Integrity team in the development, execution and follow-up of education programs for Administration, Managers and Staff on all issues related to the charge master and charge master related processes. 17. Establishes and maintains effective working relationships with Nursing, Physicians, other Clinical Staff, Information Services, HIMS and PFS to facilitate expeditious resolution of coding and billing issues related to the functionality of the CDM file and related interface processes. 18. Participates actively in team development, achieving dashboards, and in accomplishing department goals and objectives. 19. Other duties as assigned. EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE REQUIRED Associate’s Degree Required, Bachelor’s Degree Preferred Coding certification (CPC, COC, CCA, CCS, RHIT) Preferred Charge Description Master experience, Preferred EPIC certification in CDM Management, PB or HB Claims certified Preferred. If not EPIC CDM certified, must obtain EPIC CDM certification within 12 - 24 months of start date. Billing experience (professional and/or hospital) preferred. Name: Intelligence Analyst (35F)
Description: Intelligence Analyst (35F) EnlistedOfficerActive DutyArmy ReserveEntry Level Overview The intelligence analyst is primarily responsible for the analysis, processing and distribution of strategic and tactical intelligence. They are integral to providing Army personnel with information about enemy forces and potential battle areas. Job Duties Prepare all-source intelligence products to support the combat commanderAssess the significance and reliability of incoming information with current intelligenceEstablish and maintain systematic, cross-reference intelligence records and files Requirements Those who want to serve must first take the Armed Services Vocational Aptitude Battery, a series of tests that helps you better understand your strengths and identify which Army jobs are best for you. Training Job training for an intelligence analyst requires 10 weeks of Basic Combat Training and 16 weeks of Advanced Individual Training with on-the-job instruction. Part of this time is spent in the classroom and in the field. Some of the skills you’ll learn are:Critical thinkingPreparing maps, charts and intelligence reportsMilitary symbologyUsing computer systems Helpful Skills Interest in reading maps and chartsGathering information and studying its meaningAbility to think, speak and write clearlyRequired ASVAB Score(s)Skilled Technical (ST): 101Learn more about the ASVAB and see what jobs you could qualify for. Compensation Total compensation includes housing, medical, food, special pay, and vacation time. Learn more about total compensation. Earn Cash For In Demand Jobs You could earn up to $40,000 in cash bonuses just for enlisting under certain Military Occupational Specialties. Visit Jobs in Demand to see if this job qualifies for an enlistment bonus. Education Benefits In the Army, qualified students can earn full-tuition, merit-based scholarships, allowances for books and fees, plus an annual stipend for living expenses. Learn more about education benefits. Future Civilian Careers The skills you learn will help prepare you for a career in research, business planning and even government agencies such as the Central Intelligence Agency. PARTNERSHIP FOR YOUTH SUCCESS (PaYS) Program Those interested in this job may be eligible for civilian employment, after the Army, by enrolling in the Army PaYS program. The PaYS program is a recruitment option that guarantees a job interview with military friendly employers that are looking for experienced and trained Veterans to join their organization. Find out more about the Army PaYS Program at http://www.armypays.com.AAI CORPORATIONCONCURRENT TECHNOLOGIESGENERAL DYNAMICS LAND SYSTEMSLOCKHEED MARTINURS

They provide guidance and recommendations to management regarding system requirements based on company resources and business needs. HRIS Application Analysts test application configurations and functionality and provide support to end users. They must be well-versed in a variety of computer system environments and be able to troubleshoot technical issues. They are responsible for developing and implementing strategies to address problem areas with the HRIS for the Organizational Development Group. Name: Analyst - Merchandise Planning & Allocation
Description: Art Van Furniture, the Midwest’s largest Furniture and Mattress retailer, and one of the top 10 in the United States is seeking an experienced Merchandise Planning and Allocation professional to join our Merchandising team as Analyst – Merchandise Planning and Allocation.  In this high visibility / high impact position, you will report to the Director – Merchandise Planning and Allocation and work within our store merchandising group. The goal of the position is to identify and execute on key process improvement opportunities within your assigned merchandising categories. The position will work with merchandising leaders and buyers to develop merchandise flow and product allocations aimed at exceeding the financial metrics, maximize sales for productivity and profitability while fulfilling regional needs. In addition, the position will be responsible for the following: Develop, in collaboration with merchants, and execute standardized floor plans, e-slot plans that will represent a core assortment of 70% across all three operating divisions of the company.Drive and execute key inventory and merchandising strategies that impact overall business performance.Conduct analysis to evaluate product performance and identify opportunities for changes in future plans and strategies.Weekly review of promotional plans and strategies in collaboration with assigned merchant team.Co-Develop and manage monthly sales, gross margin, inventory, open-to-buy, promotional allowance, and other merchandising plans and strategies.Manage in-stock availability on A,B,C skus.Manage quality of inventory.Manage e-Slot compliance. The successful candidate will possess the following skills and experiences: Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, Merchandise Planning.Minimum 3 years of high volume merchandise planning experience in a retail environment.Creative thinker and problem solver.Experience with Word, Excel, databases and Merchandise Planning systems.Outstanding communication and leadership skills. Art Van offers a competitive salary combined with an excellent benefits package. Interested applicants can apply on-line on our website at jobs.artvan.com. Learn more about Art Van by viewing our company video at https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-zbH9Ynfp0Q&feature=youtu.be.Required Skills Required Experience Job Location  Warren, US-MI

Name: Transportation Analyst
Description: JOB DESCRIPTION:  Do you enjoy creating solutions to complex problems? Are you excited about tackling transportation  issues? Are you energized leveraging your creativity to solve real-world analytical challenges for a  new business with explosive growth? Come work with smart, enthusiastic team members and help  us build our logistics capabilities servicing millions of clients worldwide.   This role will be responsible for using analytical and quantitative methods to understand, predict,  implement, manage and enhance transportation processes. You will be responsible for assembling  data, making transportation decisions, analyzing and managing carrier performance, identifying  problems, and developing solutions which support logistics planning and operations.  RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE:   Develop excellent working relationships with business lines and all departments (Customer  Support, Quality Assurance, Operations, Finance, and Supply Chain).   Develop solid working relationships with carrier personnel, including local Account Representatives,  National and International Account Management, Customer Solutions organizations, and Senior  Leadership.   Coordinate inbound shipment arrivals with internal and external parties.   Communicate and verify all shipment volumes for product receipts in the warehouse.   Contract Management   Understand existing contract structure with carriers.   Research alternative carrier solutions to existing network.   Partner with other QuickenLoans Family Of Companies on carrier contract negotiations.   Drive expedient closure of contract terms and conditions.   Ensure contract terms are being adhered to.   Identify gaps in performance and escalate to appropriate levels of carrier management for  resolution.   Hold Monthly and Quarterly Business Reviews.   Delivery tracking, confirmation and performance management.   Use tools to track inbound shipment deliveries occur as expected.   Research discrepancies, identify causes and resolve.   Work with carriers to investigate delivery and claims issues.   Report inbound shipment status.   Work with Freight Claims Analyst to develop and improve freight claims processes.   Analyze and report on-time delivery performance.   Determine delivery performance problem areas, work with carriers and internal stakeholders on  solution development, implement fixes and report on initiative successes.   Ensure appropriate Shipping Documentation is completed for International shipments.   Transportation expense leadership   Analyze freight rates and actual freight costs.   Develop freight cost trend analysis, determine areas of improvement, implement solutions and  report on cost reduction initiatives.   Forecast freight expense and report on actual expenditures.   Analyze accessorial charges, understand root causes, and work with internal and external  stakeholders to implement necessary process improvements.   Develop sustainable freight payment processes.   Review invoices, code, send for approval and payment.   Review payment status weekly with Accounts Payable.   Ensure carriers are paid in accordance with payment terms.   Ensure data alignment across our systems and partner’s platform to drive process improvement by  partnering with carriers and internal parties.   This position plays a critical role in ensuring that the transportation & logistics group meets or exceeds  customer needs and business objectives. No task is too big or too small if it supports driving  customer satisfaction and business requirements. WORK EXPERIENCE:  1-3 years’ work experience in related field preferred. EDUCATION:  Bachelor’s degree in Supply Chain Management or Logistics Management. SKILLS & QUALIFICATIONS:  Demonstrated analytical, organizational, problem-solving and creative thinking skills.   Strong interpersonal, written, verbal communication and presentation skills, with the ability to  interface effectively with individuals at various levels.   Customer Focus.   Strong negotiation, interpersonal, and relationship building skills.   Ability to effectively prioritize workload in a fast-paced, frequently changing environment.   Ability to multitask and work independently with attention to detail and follow through.   Highly proficient with Microsoft Excel.   Passion for our business model and product categories a plus.   Position based in the Detroit Headquarters, where our Family of Companies is leading a rebirth of  the historic city. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. This job description is not all-inclusive. StockX reserves the right to amend this job description at any time.

Name: Safety Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionCentral Transport, LLC, a leader in LTL (less-than-truckload) transportation for more than 80 years is currently seeking a Safety Analyst for our Corporate Office in Warren, MI. We are in search of detail-oriented, organized individuals who are looking to begin a career or are ready to take the next step. This role is a critical position to maintaining the safety of our drivers and field locations. This is a tremendous entry level opportunity for college students, recent graduates, or experienced professionals looking for the next step! If you enjoy an energetic, team-oriented environment and would like the chance to be a part of a fast-paced, top performing company, we want to hear from you! Job Responsibilities:Managing inbound Driver Safety Check in calls, communicating to drivers about fitness for duty and ensuring their safetyAudit for driver stop-off and check-in compliance. Making outbound follow up calls to drivers that miss their respective check-inReview and make recommendations to management on lanes that have any safety issuesGeneral administration as requiredIdeal Candidate:High detail orientation and analytical skillsFamiliarity with Microsoft OfficeStrong interpersonal skillsAbility to work 2am-11amSalary and Benefits:$15-$18/HR (+$2.00/HR Shift Premium between 2am-6am)Medical/dental benefits401(k)Paid vacationLife InsuranceOpportunity for advancement Company DescriptionCentral Transport began in 1932 in Detroit, MI with a single truck and now we are consistently ranked in the top 15 LTL service providers in the nation, providing services to the United States, Mexico, and Canada. Our commitment is simple. We want to enable our customers to operate their businesses successfully, smoothly, and profitably. We tailor our operations, our technology, and our employee education to provide our customers with a shipping experience that provides value to their supply chain. We listen to what our customers say, and we are always changing to meet their expectations. The intelligence, teamwork, and dedication of our highly trained professionals allows us to make this possible.

Name: Business Systems Analyst
Description: Business Systems Analyst 28636 Mound Rd, Warren, MI 48092, USAFull-timeLegal Entity: Bosch Automotive Service Solutions Inc.Company DescriptionDo you want beneficial technologies being shaped by your ideas? Whether in the areas of mobility solutions, consumer goods, industrial technology or energy and building technology – with us, you will have the chance to improve quality of life all across the globe. Welcome to Bosch. Position your career for long term success by joining the world's most admired motor vehicle parts supplier as ranked by Fortune for the third consecutive year.Job DescriptionAs the Business Systems Analyst, you will coordinate and hold responsibility for marketing systems and processes around master data [MD] in the United States. The role will have a global component to it, as expertise gained towards processes and system execution will be leveraged throughout the Bosch Automotive Service Solutions Business Unit of the Aftermarket Division.  You will work closely with Product Managers, Sales, and Engineering functions in the business unit, and Marketing counterparts both in the region and other regions of the world to create, implement, and govern processes.  Your first major project as the Business Systems Analyst will be helping to lead a major software implementation. The transition of legacy ERP systems to a harmonized SAP environment is a leading priority over the next two years. Your responsibilities will include:Creation of Global Part Master Data System input processes and templates using existing operations and future state requirements as guidelinesTrain and Support for SAP migrations both inside the U.S. and outside of the U.S.Material establishment and maintenance of data integrityNorth American business unit representative for Master Data @ Automotive Aftermarket, which covers Product Lifecycle management, Product Information storage, and vehicle data, enabling transition to new toolset where applicableLead of creation of process documentation and collection of master data, and how it is input into associated systems for use globallyWorking with Product Manager and Engineering teams to ensure the data is correctly reported for the financialsAnalyzing current and historical data for reporting and KPI’sOwnership of product lifecycle management processCollect and input Catalog Prices and Price ceiling/floor for North American saleable goodsLead Product Hierarchy structure changes fitting to North American strategy and operations QualificationsBS, BA degree in Business, Engineering, Finance, or other related field.Minimum of 5+ years of experienceProject Management Certified preferredExperience with SAP highly preferredSystems acumen around ERP systems and Excel requiredStrong desire to investigate current process operations and improve themSelf-learner, ability to work both independently and lead team effortsMust be able to travel nationally and internationally, up to 15% travelMust be eligible to work in the US without VISA sponsorship.Not eligible for internal VA/VN international assignment. Additional InformationBy choice, we are committed to a diverse workforce-EOE/Protected Veteran/DisabledJob Location

Name: Forecasting Analyst
Description: Supply Chain – Forecasting AnalystJOB DESCRIPTION:Do you enjoy creating solutions to complex problems? Are you excited about tackling demand and supply modeling? Are you energized leveraging your creativity to solve real-world analytical problems for a new business with explosive growth? Come work with smart, enthusiastic team members and help us build our forecasting capabilities servicing millions of clients worldwide.This role will be responsible for providing information and insights regarding the demand performance of sneakers, streetwear, handbags and watches; forecasting product category sizes; and identifying industry trends. We are looking for a proactive, strategic thinker who understands and has worked with a range of industry data sources and statistical methods to build demand models.RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE:Provide information, analysis, and recommendations to drive cross-functional planning decisions.Support the business through sound decisions and forecasts built using analytics across all stages of the buy, sell and trade process.Collaborate with cross-functional team members to understand and include business trends, seasonal trends and launch events to ensure appropriate levels of operations staffing and packaging inventories.Review and analyze historical sales trends, research demand drivers, prepare forecast data, develop statistical forecast models and evaluate forecast resultsCommunicate forecasts to internal customersMonitor trends in forecast error; analyze and drive corrective actionActively participate in all meetings and be an advocate for promoting advanced forecasting methods.Drive continued improvements to forecast accuracy through cross-functional alignment and partnership, modeling, and tool creation.Lead weekly meetings with stakeholders to review actual demand performance and obtain consensus on forecasts.Design and develop custom reports and dashboards based on business needs and required data elements to track business success.Candidate must have the ability to create, clearly communicate, and maintain complex demand forecasts for multiple product categories with up to 20,000 SKUs (inputs, outputs, rationale, gaps) and provide recommendations to senior management.WORK EXPERIENCE:3+ years in demand planning, forecasting, business intelligence or related positions.EDUCATION:Bachelor's Degree in Business, Supply Chain, Economics, Finance, Statistics, Mathematics, or related field. Master’s degree in a related field is a plus.SKILLS & QUALIFICATIONS:Demonstrated analytical, organizational, problem-solving and creative thinking skills.Strong interpersonal, written, verbal communication and presentation skills.Strong team player and ability to work with the cross-functional partners and senior management on all aspects of the businessStrong interpersonal and relationship building skills.Customer Focus.Strong and demonstrated ability to effectively communicate and influence othersAbility to interpret data to make decisions and recommendations that impact the business.Advanced knowledge of MS office applications; proficiency in Excel including creating spreadsheets, complex formulas, pivot tables, macros, etc.Ability to effectively prioritize workload in a fast-paced, frequently changing environment.Ability to multitask and work independently with attention to detail and follow through.Passion for our business model and product categories a plus.Position based in the Detroit Headquarters, where our Family of Companies is leading a rebirth of the historic city. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. This job description is not all-inclusive. StockX reserves the right to amend this job description at any time.
