Name: Credit Risk Analyst
Description: Primary Duties and Responsibilities (details of the basic job functions):Develop, enhance and maintain credit risk management reporting and tools in order to: identify and analyze concentrations of credit, loan exceptions, loan classifications, delinquency, charge-off and recovery, credit quality, risk adjusted profitability, industry sector/product type/geographic exposures and trends, problem credits of consumer or home loan portfolios. Handle a range of simple to complex assignments. Prepare dashboard and ad-hoc reporting for senior management and/or regulatory compliance as needed.Use thorough understanding of statistical analysis techniques to develop and implement models and analytics which leverage risk-related information to support consumer or real estate lending business strategies and expansion, and satisfy various regulatory requirements. Create, enhance and maintain financial/statistical models for portfolio analytics purposes such as credit limit setting, loss forecasting, allowance for loan and lease losses, loan stress testing, CECL, capital allocation and etc. Prepare thorough documentation that satisfies the Banks model analytics standards, audit requirements, and the Banks regulators.Participate and contribute to periodic reviews of credit risk policies, procedures and committee governance structures. Continually assess and implement automation of reporting and portfolio analytics. Implement and maintain functional solutions or applications related to portfolio credit metrics. Develop and track forward looking credit risk metrics based on national macroeconomic data as well as internal data. Complete other projects and initiatives in support of broader Credit Administration goals.Supervisory Responsibilities (briefly describe, if applicable, or indicate None):NonePreferred Qualifications:Education:Masters degree in Economics, Finance, Statistics or AccountingWork Environment:Work in a temperature-controlled office environment.Qualifications:Required Qualifications (these are the minimum requirements to qualify):Education (include minimum education and any licensing/certifications):Bachelor degree in Economics, Finance, Statistics or AccountingExperience:Five years of banking or related work experience in Credit, Risk Management, Corporate Treasury or Corporate and/or Line-of-Business FinanceExtensive experience with advanced Excel functions such as Macro and VBAAdditional Item to Post for Home Loan Portfolio Credit Risk AnalystReal estate lending experience, affordable housing experienceAdditional Item to Post for Consumer Loan Portfolio Credit Risk AnalystConsumer lending including auto loan and other consumer loan experienceKnowledge and Skills:Thorough statistical analysis of underlying data requiring regression and time series analyses, and understanding of risk factors that impact the credit quality of portfolios.Strong understanding of quantitative credit risk modeling (e.g., PDs, LGDs, EADs, vintage analysis, migration matrices, etc)Strong understanding of portfolio credit metrics such as limits, expected and unexpected loss, capital allocation, etc.)Excellent quantitative and financial modeling and analytical skills, including statistical/mathematical programming experience using SAS and/or RSolid oral and very good written communication skills with the ability to explain complex topics to multiple levels higher and lower in the organization and to synthesize quantitative results and qualitative factors into conclusions suitable for executives and regulators

Name: Supply Chain Analyst
Description: Supply Chain Analyst  AJM Packaging Corporation is a leading manufacturer of private label consumer paper products, including paper plates, cups, bags, and bowls. We are currently looking for a Supply Chain Analyst to add to our team, in our Detroit, MI facility. This is a great opportunity to begin a career in Supply Chain Management!  Position Requirements include:  Provide direct support to the Plant Manager, by primarily coordinating and executing assigned tasks in order to optimize the safe and efficient operation of the plant and to maximize profits while rotating across multiple roles and experiences in an upwardly progressing Management Trainee Program.  Gather data and conducts analysis with the goal of improving the organizations supply chain operations. Identifies under-performing areas in the supply chain and may suggest improvements or resolutions to problems. May assist in the negations of supplier agreements  Plan supply chain optimization projects (warehouse slotting, route planning)  Develop Requirements and standards (packaging and procurement)  Track KPI's and report on supply chain performance  Evaluate vendor operations according to quality standards  Collaborate with IT to implement effective systems  Collect and analyze supply chain data  Recommend improvements to reduce cost and improve performance  Coordinate with department managers to implement approved changes  Education and Experience:  Prefer Associate's degree (A. A.) or equivalent from two-year College and two years of related experience; or equivalent combination of education and experience.  Possess working knowledge of personal computer, in particular MS Word, Excel, Access, and Microsoft AX.  Possess strong verbal and written communication skills.  Able to effectively manage multiple tasks.  Ability to work in fast past environment and provide solution based corrective plans  Possess strong organizational skills.  Willing to take initiative and ownership of problems to find solutions.  Training and some work will be performed at AJM Plant and shipping facilities  Participate in annual physical inventory during the month of July.  This position May require travel.  Benefits:  As an AJM employee, you will receive a competitive salary and benefits package including medical insurance, short-term disability, a 401(k) plan, and paid vacation days. For more information about the benefits package for this position, please speak to a Human Resources representative during the application process.  What?s Next:  Recognizing that the skills and passion of our employees drive our continued success, we strive to hire top talent who share our vision and values. If you are interested in joining our team and finding your place at our growing company, apply today. Education and Experience:1-3 years related experience or bachelor’s degree in related areaWorking knowledge of MS office and regional databases and ERP systemsExcellent communication skill and organizational abilityUnderstand industry concepts, practices or procedures. Relies on judgments to plan and accomplish goals and preforms a variety of complicated tasksAnalytical mind with business acumenProblem solving aptitudeAttention to DetailNeed to get fork lift certified and training within 6 monthsWill be on feet or walking during certain training stations for long periods of time We are looking for a dynamic, highly motivated, self-starter to bring their skills and dedication to an established and growing company! AJM Packaging offers competitive compensation, along with a great benefits package. Don’t miss this excellent career opportunity!

Name: Senior Planning Analyst
Description: About DENSO DENSO is one of the largest global automotive suppliers of advanced technology, systems and components in the areas of thermal, powertrain control, electronics and information and safety. From automated driving to hybrid and electric vehicle components, were crafting the core technologies of modern mobility. We draw on the strengths of individual inventors who are joining together to become an unstoppable force for global good. With our North American headquarters located in Michigan, DENSO employs more than 24,000 people at 28 consolidated subsidiaries and 4 affiliates across the North American region. Worldwide, the company has more than 200 subsidiaries and affiliates in 38 countries and regions and employs more than 170,000 people. Consolidated global sales for the fiscal year ending March 31, 2018, totaled US$48.1 billion. Job Summary Under direct supervision, assists in the analysis and forecasting of financial, economic and other data to provide timely and accurate information for strategic and operational decisions. Gathers and performs basic analysis of financial information on costs, expenses and revenues.  • Assist in RHQ's Annual & Revised Plan activities Act as liaison between CPD Management and RHQ Departments to process financial data requests. Listen carefully to each Departments & Affiliates problems to achieve targets through daily activities. Prepare monthly management reports, variance and trend analyses and financial review documents.Support need for ad-hoc reporting and presentations, including business reviews and management presentation.Develop financial analyses, business scenarios and other modeling to support strategic decision making and initiatives. Assess the impact of future business changes to the Company P & LAchieve Regional / Global reporting deliverables to meet deadlines Strengthen the processes and systems for collecting, analyzing and presenting management and business information. Assist in the developing of NA's standard planning process / system.Respect Customer & Team Members opinions to collaboratively resolve problems. Requirements: • Bachelor Degree in Accounting or Finance  3 years of relevant experienceStrong interpersonal skills and effective communicator across all levels of the organization.Excellent oral and written communication skills. Able to present information in meaningful & concise formats.Strong leadership skills with an ability to affect change through objective analysis and reason.Highly organized, with strong multi-tasking skills to effectively manage multiple and competing priorities and demands.Strong systems orientation to ensure maximizing current reporting systems.Preferred: Minimum 5 years of Financial Accounting, Budget or Cost Accounting Experience, including a minimum 2 - 3 years of Strategic Planning of Busniess planning experience. Minimum 3 years of Strategic Planning or Business Planning Experience Knowledge of Oracle EPM of Hyperion Planning

Name: Senior Sales Operations Analyst (APTIV)
Description: Control-tec, an Aptiv company, is a worldwide provider of telematics and analytics solutions currently serving the transportation industries in the light duty, heavy duty, agriculture, locomotive, and industrial sectors. CT® combines affordable information technology with comprehensive data acquisition to provide an enterprise solution for fleet management, product development and quality. More than 80% of US automotive OEMs have utilized our tools to deliver the speed, flexibility, reliability, cost savings and collaboration needed in today's environment. Position Summary: The Sales Operations Analyst supports business activities and processes that help a sales organization run effectively and efficiently in support of business strategies and objectives. Sales operations activities significantly contribute to the success of a sales organization and that organizations ability to meet/exceed business targets. This position is ideal for someone who enjoys optimizing processes, creating analyses that inform business decisions, and supporting strategic initiatives that drive sales growth. You will participate in multiple projects at a time, focused on the details, while finding creative ways to tackle big picture challenges.  Job Responsibilities Improve sales performance through better processes, technology and methodologiesProactively monitor and strive to maintain high levels of quality, accuracy, and process consistency in the sales organizationProactively identify opportunities for sales process improvement by analyzing trends, results and feedback from the sales organizationSupport development of easily digestible analyses from complex data sources that will inform strategic business decisions and help predict future gaps/disruptionsLead daily management of Administrator tasks in SalesForce.com and automation, etc. in an effort to improve our tools / process for identifying and managing opportunitiesMonitor the sales organizations compliance with required standards for maintaining CRM data integrityPrepare custom contracting and pricing proposals to support the sales representatives for prospects/clientsAssist sales team members with Salesforce.com data entry as neededAssist in developing, reporting, and automating key performance metrics, reporting tools, and dashboards to help drive revenue and optimize sales efficiencyHelp develop training materials and user-facing documentation for business processesOperational and analytical support for company and sales leadershipLead efforts to improve market analytics data on prospective customers / market share as well as analytic insights on existing customers with opportunities for improved penetration within the Transportation Industries SegmentCoordination across key parts of the business (i.e. Sales, Operations, Finance, Product, Marketing) to ensure the highest level of customer satisfaction Minimum Requirements Bachelor's degreeExpert level Excel spreadsheet skillsSalesForce and database query skills are a plusReporting and data presentation capabilitiesStrong interpersonal and communication skillsAbility to work effectively in a team setting Apply Online Ready to take the first step? Sales experience preferred  Excellent punctuality and attendance in addition to active listening skills a must  Excellent communication skills What we Offer:Concentrix provides our associates with:Career Pathing and Advancement OpportunitiesCompetitive salaryMonthly performance incentivesHealth insurance (Eligibility requirements must be met)The Company: Concentrix is a high-value global business services company. Name: Desktop Support Analyst I

Name: Core Intelligence Senior Analyst
Description: About CitiCiti, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management. Our core activities are safeguarding assets, lending money, making payments and accessing the capital markets on behalf of our clients.Citi’s Mission and Value Proposition explains what we do and Citi Leadership Standards explain how we do it. Our mission is to serve as a trusted partner to our clients by responsibly providing financial services that enable growth and economic progress. We strive to earn and maintain our clients’ and the public’s trust by constantly adhering to the highest ethical standards and making a positive impact on the communities we serve. Our Leadership Standards is a common set of skills and expected behaviors that illustrate how our employees should work every day to be successful and strengthens our ability to execute against our strategic priorities.Diversity is a key business imperative and a source of strength at Citi. We serve clients from every walk of life, every background and every origin. Our goal is to have our workforce reflect this same diversity at all levels. Citi has made it a priority to foster a culture where the best people want to work, where individuals are promoted based on merit, where we value and demand respect for others and where opportunities to develop to are widely available to all.DescriptionIn support to the Cyber Security Fusion Center (CSFC) mission, the CSFC Core Team is responsible for analyzing cyber threat information designed to increase Citi's cyber threat awareness and protection levels. By providing awareness, indications, warnings, and operational readiness, the CSFC Core Team protects the Citi brand, global business operations, technology infrastructure and client trust against cyber threats worldwide. In order to achieve the above results, this position will be responsible for the below functions:Perform cyber threat analysis, alerting, and reporting based on intelligence and information gathered from both internal and external sources.Conduct research using multiple data sources, perform analysis and disseminate findings to both technical and non-technical consumers throughout Citi.Work daily with different Information Security teams to gather intelligence and data for analysis.Work with Security Operation teams to collect data for incident metrics reporting.Apply expertise in both host and network analysis to ascertain the impact of an attack and develop threat trends and mitigation techniques and countermeasures that can prevent future attacks.Provide cyber threat analysis to support development and research teams.Initiate trend analysis based on available data to identify anomalies.Report on the continuous evolution of Cyber Security policy trends and issues, and review new requirements.Aid Cyber Security Fusion teams in developing and implementing advanced threat actor hunt methodologies and detection mechanisms.Coordinate analytic and investigative efforts amongst technical and intelligence teams during a critical cyber event or crisis. QualificationsBachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience.Prior experience working in a cyber-threat analysis related function. Understanding of security event monitoring concepts and escalation processes.Demonstrated methodical, data-driven approach to security analysis, with an ability to think laterally and creatively to implement security improvements and detect and respond to incidentsDetailed and extensive knowledge of Network Forensic tools and analysis techniques with a proven ability of identifying malicious traffic and infection vectors. Working experience in analyzing Netflow, DNS, Proxy and web access logs.Extensive knowledge of advanced network exfiltration techniques.Extensive experience in packet capture analysis using TCPdump or Wireshark. Cisco and SANS certifications such as CCNA, GCIH, or equivalent are desiredAbility to review information to determine its significance, validate its accuracy and assess its reliability to technical and non-technical audiences.Extensive knowledge of APTs and an understanding of attributing TTPs, malware and cyber-attacks to them.Should have an extensive knowledge of the following areasCyber crimeComputer ForensicsHacktivismDenial of Service attacksMalware analysisHost/Network-based intrusion detectionNetwork monitoring, IDS/IPS, Firewalls, Proxy servers, load balancers.Symmetric and Public Key EncryptionCapability to provide technical analysis of various data log types from multiple operating systems, and origins such as:Proxy AD Registry DLPKnowledge of scripting and/ or programming languages including Python, PHP, Perl, Bash, C , or others.Experience developing tools to assist in analyzing various forms of cyber threat data. Must be a self-starter, self-motivated and able to work independently with little oversight.Strong cyber security analytical and situational awareness skills.Exceptional written and verbal communication and presentation skills to internal and external customers

Name: Applications Systems Analyst II
Description: Job DescriptionCompany Overview: Wolverine Advanced Materials, an entity of ITT Corporation's Motion Technologies Division, is a leading developer and manufacturer of high performance materials. Our core competency is in performance-critical, specialty elastomercoated metals that offer damping and seal-ability solutions in the automotive and gasket industries.  ITT is a diversified leading manufacturer of highly engineered critical components and customized technology solutions for the energy, transportation and industrial markets. Building on its heritage of innovation, ITT partners with its customers to deliver enduring solutions to the key industries that underpin our modern way of life. Founded in 1920, ITT is headquartered in White Plains, N.Y., with employees in more than 35 countries and sales in a total of approximately 125 countries. The company generated 2014 revenues of $2.7 billion. For more information, visit www.itt.com .  Motion Technologies is one of four ITT Value Centers focused on the Transportation industry. The Motion Technologies Value Center generates over $862M in revenues and is made up of three businesses. Position Summary: This position is responsible for providing IT support to end users on ERP system and related infrastructure and proactively coordinate/escalate and resolve issues for end users. The above is intended to describe the general content of, and the requirements for, the performance of this position. It is not to be construed as an exhaustive statement of duties, responsibilities, or requirements. (OR 3- 5 years job related experience required if no degree)IT technology background on Microsoft products (Windows 10, Windows 2012, Windows 2016, Active Directory, Microsoft Office 365).ERP support experience is a plus. Name: Senior SAP Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionPOSITION SUMMARY: The Senior SAP Analyst will engage directly as first level support for all corporate locations of CERATIZIT Group in the US in all SAP matters, to deliver high quality solutions and enhancements to the existing SAP manufacturing template. This position plays a major role in the implementation and development of core business processes and mentors and guides others in the organization. The Senior Business Analyst serves as lead in medium to large projects, manages deadlines, manages business communication and provides status updates.  This position will research and resolve production support issues, develop functional specifications from business requirements, coordinate development (SD, MM,PP, LE modules), provide technical support and contribute to overall software architecture and process solutions. The individual will be responsible for the solution, design, system configuration, testing the solutions, creating deliverables related to the project(s) and assisting in post implementation support. RESPONSIBILITIES/DUTIES:First level support for all corporate locations of CERATIZIT Group Americas in all SAP matters, with a focus in the SD, MM, PP, LE modules.Implementation, development, and maintenance of all SAP application support and all SAP modules for the North and South American region.Regular on-site support in the CERATIZIT sites of North and South America with the implementation of quality improvement measures such as user training and process improvements.Support for SAP rollouts, including: on-site training and support.Responsible for solving complex problems; design, configure, test and implement solutions for the SAP SD.Analyzes business needs, documents requirements and translates needs into functional, non-functional and/or technical specifications. Performs analysis, and evaluates downstream business, systems, process, and/or organizational impacts.Analyzes the process to be implemented, defines system requirements in terms of system capabilities and configures SAP.Maintains a high level of functional competency regarding standard SAP configurations and keeping current on SAP trends & future enhancements.Collaborates with the development team in order to achieve desired end-results on complex problems by delivering scalable business process solutions.Plans and assists with oversight of testing processes and activities including defect identification and resolution.Develops or assists in the development of work plans, time schedules, project task items, and assists with estimating resource needs for analysts, developers, business user personnel, and consultants.Advises business partners on the implications of standard or new SAP solutions that can be applied to a problem.Identifies risks and issues and seeks approval on complex matters.Documents quality training material for business users.Builds strong relationships with business partners.Exhibits patience and devotes time to understand current state processes and configuration.Provides subject matter expertise and production support to internal business partners on an ongoing basis. Performs all other related duties as assigned.Travel up to 40% domestically and internationally dependent on project needs.Maintenance and use of the company-wide help desk application.Coordinate with Europe (CERATIZIT Global HQ) on issues effecting day to day processes that need to be improvedParticipation in the Center of Competence IT-ApplicationsEDUCATION AND/OR EXPERIENCE REQUIRED:Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, IT, Computer Science, Information Systems or Business Management3-5 years’ SAP experience, preferably Key User or First Level SupportUnderstanding with the following modules within SAP: SD, MM, PP, LEExperience in business processes and business processes in relation to SAP core processes.Good understanding of special SAP processes such as SAP custom manufacturing, goods movements, inventory management, material planning, etc. are beneficial.Experience in SAP customization and ABAP is desirable but not mandatory.Maintain high level of quality while working under pressure and deadlines.Ability to document new processes and train end-users.Demonstrated ability to communicate both verbally and in writing across all levels of the organizations.A working knowledge of project management.Strong Excel skills highly desired.Willingness to travel on the American continent and to Europe. Company DescriptionFor over 95 years, we have been developing and producing sophisticated hard material cutting and wear protection solutions: From highly specialized cutting tools, indexable inserts and carbide rods to new types of carbide and cermet grades for wood and stone working. The constant innovation of materials and applications helps us and our customers to create a large number of machines, tools, applications, and consumer goods which shape our immediate environment and are part of our everyday life.

Name: Advanced Analytics Senior Consultant
Description: Urban Science is a business-solutions company focused on supporting the needs of the sales and marketing function of the automotive industry. We leverage a scientific methodology to help our client partners sell more vehicles, improve profitability and increase customer loyalty. And we do that by helping solve their toughest challenges including planning an optimal dealership network, improving individual dealer performance and efficiently converting sales leads into sales. In short, we guide business through science—and we’ve been doing this since 1977. OVERVIEW: The Advanced Analytics Senior Consultant is focused on both technical & client handling skills to execute high quality projects and assignments with a high degree of accuracy in a timely manner. The Senior Consultant will be responsible for developing forecasting studies, econometric models, and statistical analysis. Support the daily industry sales forecasting system using SAS/ETS.Responsible for building and maintaining econometric, time series, and forecasting advanced analytics.Modeling tasks may include regression, decision trees, hierarchical GLMs, panel data, machine learning, Monte-Carlo simulations, and optimization.Plans, organizes, develops and delivers client requested reports and deliverables on time, adhering to client requested specifications.Tracks, processes, analyzes and verifies data in order to improve accuracy and quality.Develops moderately complex statistical models and updates existing models to validate effectiveness for various clients using techniques such as regression, decision trees, and artificial neural nets.Collects, imports, and organizes relevant data within statistical software such as SAS, R, or Python to support modeling development and maintenance.Collaborates with internal and external clients to collect requirements and specifications. in order to conduct complex statistical analyses.Uses SQL server to extract, process and prepare data for statistical modeling.Attends project meetings and participants in presenting project status updates, conclusions and results.Adheres to quality control standards for Urban Science and client organizations.Design, develop, and maintain quality assurance (QA) reports of forecasting processes using MS Excel and/or MS Power BI.Coordinates with individuals or teams to complete analyses, tasks and projects on time and with high quality. Responsible for creating work estimates on own individual projects.Effectively responds to client inquiries/requests in a timely manner to help improve client satisfaction.Proactively communicates with management to provide updates and report issues in a timely manner.Actively supports and participates in training programs to achieve targeted development objectives. May have responsibility to train / mentor other Associates in processes, procedures and methodologies.Works with manager in completing own annual goal setting and performance review in a timely manner.Works with manager to prioritize other duties as assigned. To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, ability and/or competency needed for successful performance in the role. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Verbal Communication: Requires the ability to compose and verbally deliver information of varying levels, using appropriate grammar, tone, inflection and non-verbal cues, while also listening to and correctly deciphering verbal communication delivered by othersWritten Communication:Requires the ability and capacity to communicate ideas, facts and data in writing using appropriate grammar, syntax and sentence structureAnalytical Thinking: Requires the ability to understand a situation by breaking it apart into smaller pieces, and/or tracing the implications of a situation in a step-by-step causal wayConceptual Thinking: Requires the ability to understand a situation or problem by putting the different pieces together to see the bigger picture.Information Seeking: Requires the drive to gain a deeper understanding of work related issues or events by making a concerted effort to gather information and seek out development opportunitiesFlexibility/Adaptability: Requires the ability to adapt to and work effectively within a variety of situations, individuals or groups, as well as understand and appreciate different and opposing perspectivesResults Oriented: Requires the ability to strive for optimal results by taking responsibility for timeliness, commitment to task and adherence to performance standardsInitiative: Requires the drive to go above and beyond in order to improve or enhance job resultsSelf-Confidence: Requires the ability to express confidence in dealing with challenging circumstances, in reaching decisions or forming opinions and in handling failures or set-backs constructivelyOrganizational Commitment: Requires the ability and willingness to align his/her own behavior with the needs, priorities and goals of the organizationEthics & Integrity: Requires the ability to behave in a trustworthy & transparent mannerTeamwork & Cooperation: Requires the ability to work cooperatively with others and be part of a teamSelf-Control: Requires the ability to keep emotions under control and to restrain from negative actions or behaviorsQuality Control: Requires the ability to monitor and check work related information and deliverables ensuring high quality and accuracyCustomer Service Oriented: Requires the ability to follow up on a client inquiry, request or complaint by taking routine or required action and will keep the client up to date on progress of tasks/projects/requests.Interpersonal Understanding: Requires the ability to understand other’s feelings and concerns, and to value individual differences in peopleOrganization & Time Management: Requires the ability to prioritize competing demands and manage multiple concurrent tasks.Project Management: Knowledge and understanding of project management principles and fundamentals is strongly preferred, including the ability to estimate work effortsRelationship Building: Requires the ability to effectively build and maintain friendly, warm relationships or networks of contacts with clients/customersDatabase: Requires working knowledge of relational database concepts, gathering and manipulating data manually; knowledge and experience with SQL is required.Math & Statistics: Requires extensive knowledge of a statistical modeling language (SAS, R, Python); requires formal education/training in advanced analytical modeling techniques, mathematics, statistics, or econometrics. Requires knowledge of forecasting techniques such as ARIMA, ESM, UCM, ARCH/GARCH, state space and similar modeling.Technical/Software: Requires knowledge and understanding of programming in SAS, R and/or Python language, preferably SAS & SAS/ETS. Experience with data mining package (e.g. SAS Enterprise Miner, Enterprise Guide) strongly preferred.MS Office: Requires demonstrated knowledge of MS Excel for charting and graphing of data, writing formulas, utilizing functions, and filtering, sorting and formatting of data; intermediate knowledge of MS Word, and PowerPoint is required.EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE:University degree in an appropriate technical or analytical field required (i.e., engineering, applied math, statistics, etc.) from an accredited college or university, or equivalent foreign institutionMust have a minimum of 3 years relevant work experienceRequires 2+ years experience building and implementing advanced analytical modelsRequires experience implementing models in complex industry applicationsExperience with data mining, machine learning concepts and techniques requiredExperience with Python, R, and/or SAS programming requiredExperience with SAS/ETS or other econometric, time-series software packages requiredExperience with SQL programming requiredCERTIFICATES, LICENSES, REGISTRATIONS:SAS Basic Programming Certification preferredSAS Advanced Programming Certification preferredSAS Base Predictive Modeling Certification preferredWORK ENVIRONMENT: The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  This description is intended to describe the type and level of work being performed by a person assigned to this position. It is NOT an exhaustive list of all duties and responsibilities required by a person so classified. The job may require additional hours beyond the normal 40-hour workweek.

Name: Senior Financial Analyst, Financial Reporting
Description: RGP is a global Consulting and Executive Search firm helping some of the most recognized companies in the world work differently. Whether it?s a position in Accounting, Finance, Audit, Tax, Technology, Human Resources or Supply Chain, we understand the challenges in finding the next opportunity on your career path. We will connect you to opportunities that matter, putting your expertise to best use while developing skills for the future.  Our Executive Recruiters have established relationships with many of the best and brightest professionals in the industry. Based on our unique approach to recruiting and expertise in assessing opportunities and talent, we have the ability to expose you to the top career opportunities on the market.  As we continue to grow and deepen our impact on organizations around the world, we are looking for the right people to place in key executive roles. If you are interested in finding the best opportunity on your career path, there a few things you should know about RGP:  + We are energized by the opportunity of identifying and placing top Executive talent.  + We like working with organizations that are positive, adaptable and growth-minded.  + We care how work gets accomplished and are deeply invested in the success of our clients and their Executive Professionals.  If this sounds like you, we invite you to read on and learn more. *THE RGP EXECUTIVE SEARCH EXPERIENCE** At RGP, we?re deeply invested in identifying your strengths as an Executive Professional. We understand it?s not simply about finding a position ? it?s about your career objectives, goals and aspirations. In other words, it?s about you. *PURPOSE OF THE ROLE** As a Senior Financial Analyst, Financial Reporting, you will be responsible for preparing the quarterly Form 10-Q and Form 10-K filings with the Securities and Exchange Commission, including coordination with other functional areas to obtain supporting information. In this role, you will consolidate the monthly results from approximately 60 locations throughout the world and the preparation of financial information for various members of the leadership team. *KEY RESPONSIBILITIES OF THE ROLE** + Assist in the preparation of the monthly and quarterly consolidated financial statements including the consolidated balance sheet and cash flow statement.  + Assist with technical accounting research and documentation.  + Prepare and analyze consolidated operating data and statistics.  + Responsible for the preparation of separate audit financial statements  + Assist with special projects as assigned. *DESIRED EXPERIENCE AND REQUIREMENTS** + Bachelor?s Degree in Accounting or Finance  + MBA and/or CPA preferred  + 5+ years of accounting or finance experience  + SEC Reporting experience preferred *Equal Opportunity Employer** RGP is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer and committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, gender, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, physical or mental disability, genetic information or veteran status, and encourage all applicants to apply.

We are an IT Consulting company with offices in Detroit, MI, Columbus, OH, Cleveland, OH, Cincinnati, OH, New York, Hartford, CT, Massachusetts, Minneapolis, MN, Los Angeles, CA, San Francisco, CA, and Tucson, AZ. We’re doing business in almost half the states in the union.  We're a financially strong, privately-held company that is 100% consultant and client focused. You are our most important asset!  We've differentiated ourselves by being creative, flexible, and fast. Throw out everything you've heard, seen, or felt about every other IT Consulting company.  We're different. Our consultants and clients tell us so, and it's our great people who make the difference! We do unique things, and we do them for Fortune 10 companies, Inc. 500 companies, and technology start-ups. We also have a strong belief in giving back to the communities we serve.  Our benefits are second to none and thanks to our flexible benefits options you can choose just the benefits that you need or want, options include:  • Medical and Dental (Fast Switch pays majority of the medical program)  • Vision  • Personal Time Off (PTO) Program  • Long Term Disability (100% paid)  • Life Insurance (100% paid)  • 401(k) with immediate vesting and 3% (of salary) dollar-for-dollar match  Plus, we have a lucrative employee referral program and an employee recognition culture.  In 2013, 2014, 2015, 2016 and 2017, Fast Switch was named one of the Top Work Places in Michigan by the Detroit Free Press and one of the Best Staffing Firms in 2016 and 2017. We have won the Columbus Business First “Fast 50” award 9 times in 12 years because of our strong growth which translates into more and better opportunities for our consulting staff members.  To view all of our open positions, please go to: www.fastswitch.com and at the bottom of the page click Job Opportunities, or get there directly at: http://tinyurl.com/z6r74up  You can also follow us on Twitter at: www.twitter.com/fastswitch  And you can become a fan of Fast Switch on Facebook at: http://tinyurl.com/y9y3gdp

Name: Programmer / Analyst
Description: Position : Programmer / Analyst  Job Duties :  Perform all lifecycle phases of project, including requirements/specification, development/coding, unit testing, and system integration testing. Implement J2EE design patterns such as Business Facade, Singleton and DAO. Implement STRUTS Model View Controller architecture to develop presentation tier and business layer. Implement STRUTS framework (Action and Controller classes) for dispatching request to appropriate class. Use simple Struts Validation for validation of user input as per the business logic and initial data loading. Work on SOAP based JAX-WS Web Service Components deployable to WebSphere application server and implement Web Service Client using Dynamic proxy Model. Develop Enterprise JavaBeans for the business flow (Entity and Session Beans). Develop Session beans by using EJBs for business logic at the middle tier. Work on the persistence layer using Hibernate to map the java classes to corresponding data. Develop test cases and Unit testing using JUnit. Implement Stateless and State full Session beans to capture user data and to achieve scalability and memory management. Use Perforce for the version control of the Project. Write ANT Build scripts to Compile and build the application. Develop presentation layer using JSP, HTML, JavaScript, JQuery, Ajax and CSS. Implement Service Oriented Architecture (SOA) using XML Web Services (SOAP, WSDL and UDDI). Use JMS in transforming the high level of information across applications and develop framework by using JMS. Configure and perform administration of Connection pools, Data Sources, Queues, Connection Factories, and Listeners for development environment.  Work location : various unanticipated work locations throughout the United States; relocation may be required. Must be willing to relocate.  Minimum Qualifications Education :  Masters – Computer Science or Information Systems;  Experience : None.  Other Requirements :  Must be willing to relocate..  Job Order No : 7086240.  This position is eligible for a referral bonus through our employee referral program.  Position : Programmer / Analyst  Job Duties :  Migrate applications from Citrix XenApp 4.5 farm to Citrix XenApp 6.5. Prepare App-V5.0 SP3 Servers for Data Center Consolidation. Design, develop and suppo rt application packaging solutions for Citrix and VDI environments. Maintain App-V Servers and virtual applications for Citrix PVS. Virtualize applications using App-V 5.0 SP3 and VMware ThinApp 5.0 for Windows 7 and Citrix Server 2008R2. Manage Publish and Un-publish of applications using App-V Publishing Console. Integrate application package solutions with Microsoft System Center Configuration Manager (SCCM) 2012. Preform scripting and automated installation of software on computer using knowledge of software packaging, re-packaging, customization, testing and distribution systems and methods. Perform software distribution, diagnose software installation errors and perform corrective actions. Monitor the timely and error-free install of applications and software updates. Create custom actions for Install, Repair, and Uninstall actions. Troubleshoot App-V issues on client systems using PowerShell and other 3rd party App-V tools and log all support related interactions. And use Oracle..  Minimum Qualifications Education :  Work location : various unanticipated work locations throughout the United States; relocation may be required. Name: Analytics Commercialization Analyst
Description: Position Overview/Description: Ford Global Data Insight and Analytics (GDI&A) is a growing team that islooking foran experienced technical professional to jointheSmart Mobility Analytics team. This position reports to the Analytics Strategy Leader responsible for scaling analytic operations in the fast-growing Ford Smart Mobility business. Smart Mobility Analytics is an exciting innovation space where Data Science and Software Engineering merge to create innovative solutions to solve global mobility challenges. This is an exciting, fast-paced role which requires exceptional technology leadership skills combined with business delivery skills to drive success in the marketplace. The successful candidate will have a natural passion for winning in the marketplace along with demonstrated success as an agile product team player. Key Responsibilities: Day to day responsibilities may include but are not limited to: Analytics Use Case: Develop multi-level use-case documentation and communication artifacts to engage various stakeholders within Ford to articulate analytic requirements, data usages, commercial terms, and solution architecture needs. Requires development of reusable templates to communicate requirements to multiple stakeholders, from highly technical to executive leadership summaries. Data Operations Engagement: Act as the central control for the analytics team to identify all tasks, requirements, follow-up, communication and coordination with GDI&A Data Operations teams. This includes data procurement needs, data governance considerations, commercial data use terms and impact to quality of solution/customer experience. Includes documenting process/architecture and identifying touchpoints for Analytic Commercialization projects. IT Engagement: Participate within Analytic/Software product teams across multiple stakeholders, including Architects, Product Owners, Developer Leaders, Agile Coaches etc. Assist analytic technical leader with identifying testing strategies for paired programming (Data Science plus software engineer), timeline estimates, user story management, and resource forecasting. Act as a SME to support efficiencies to commercial delivery with an understanding of IT SDL (Software Development Lifecycle) evolving for Analytic-driven code development. Job RequirementsBasic Qualifications:Bachelor's degree is required10+ years of professional experience in IT, Project Management, Business (Sales, Marketing, Communications, etc.)5+ years of experience in Client/Customer facing roles2+ years of experience leading Data Analytics implementations2+ years of experience in data warehousing processes (e.g., internal/external data acquisition, data quality, data governance)Preferred Qualifications:Master's DegreePMP Certification for 2+ yearsCBAP Certification for 2+ yearsExperience delivering project scope across multiple industriesExperience in Automotive Industry, Transportation Industry or Analytics ConsultingExperience in Project ManagementExperience in Portfolio Strategy and ManagementExecutive Presentation preparation and deliveryAgile Product Team experience for 3+ yearsComfortable working in a dynamic environment where problems are not always well-definedInquisitive, proactive, and interested in learning new tools and techniquesStrong oral, written and interpersonal communication skillsStrong leadership skills, both in formal and informal teams The distance between imagination and ... creation. It can be measured in years of innovation, or in moments of brilliance. When you join the Ford team discover all the benefits, rewards and development opportunities you'd expect from a diverse global leader. You'll become part of a team that is already leading the way, with ingenious solutions and attainable products - and it is always to go further.  Candidates for positions with Ford Motor Company must be legally authorized to work in the United States on a permanent basis. Verification of employment eligibility will be required at the time of hire. Visa sponsorship is not available for this position.  Ford Motor Company is an equal opportunity employer committed to a culturally diverse workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, age, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability status or protected veteran status.

Name: Sr. Programmer Analyst - Data Management
Description: The Senior Programmer Analyst will provide the technical expertise to translate data sources into actionable outputs as part of marketing solutions. This includes user interfaces, data loading, database design, marketing business rule analysis, program generation, and execution. Process flow diagrams and quality control checks will aid in program clarity and successful execution. This role is responsible for the design and development of systems to support client-marketing processes and internal Team Detroit systems. The Senior Programmer Analyst is responsible for analyzing current processes and recommending simplifications and enhancements to improve accuracy, delivery time, and cost. The Senior Programmer Analyst is required to be knowledgeable in SQL-Server 2005/2008 tools, VB.Net, ASP.net, ASP, HTML, IIS, relational databases, and to provide the technical interface with client and internal technical groups.MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES / PRINCIPAL ACCOUNTABILITIES:• Analyze business processes in order to refine and automate them.• Automate and maintain client-related and internal processes.• Design and develop systems and relational databases to support client projects and internal systems.• Perform / supervise data hygiene procedures.• Create and pull a wide range of reports from the local and remote data-access tools. • Design and implement quality control procedures.• Manage data resources to support client and internal work.• Estimate effort required to develop specified systems.• Assist in other data and analytics work as necessary.• Recommend measures to improve work process methods, equipment performance, and quality of product, as appropriate.• Maintain and support all company standards as specified within the Quality Management System. • Supports/facilitates the mandatory adherence to ISO9001 requirements, processes and procedures.• Perform other duties and projects as assigned.KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS:• Medium to large-scale application development experience required.• Relational database design experience including use of entity relationship diagrams.• Working knowledge of data-interface protocols.• SQL Server 2008 or later, SSIS, SSRS, SSAS .NET, HTML, COM, DCOM.MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:• Previous Work Experienceo 3-5 years’ experience with SQL Server with sound SQL knowledge.o 2-3 years’ experience with SSIS and SSRS, SSAS.o 2-3 years’ experience in VB.Net, C#.Net, ASP.Net, ADO.NET, HTML and other similar tools.o 1-2 years’ experience in MVC framework• Experience Preferredo Cascading Style Sheets (CSS)o Systems Development Life Cycle experience (requirements, design, build, test, etc.) preferred • Educational Backgroundo BS (Computer Science or Information Systems preferred) or equivalent experience preferred.• Othero Have physical and mental requirements to meet the above listed job responsibilities.DISCLAIMER:The above information on this description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees assigned to the job.As an Equal Opportunity Employer, GTB Agency, LLC. does not discriminate against applicants or employees because of age, race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, genetics, pregnancy-related status, veteran status, physical or mental disability where the individual is otherwise qualified, national or ethnic origin, or on any other basis where protected by local, state, or federal law.#LI-JM1

Name: State & Local-Technology Management Consultant-Manager
Description: OverviewWhat do you get when you bring together the brightest minds and place them into an exciting, fast-paced environment that fosters intellectual growth and rewards based on impact, not tenure?  You get one of the fastest growing consulting companies in the United States. While we may be a new name in consultancy, we were born from a storied one. Guidehouse was founded in 2018 as an evolution of PwC Public Sector with a mission to help our clients deliver on their mission; providing bold new strategies that catalyze transformative results across all ends of the enterprise. We embrace brilliance. We embrace independence. Join us.ResponsibilitiesGuidehouse, LLP helps federal, state, and local governments solve complex business issues, manage risk and add value in financial management, program management, operations improvement, and security and data management. In today's changing environment, the public sector is seeing an increase in physical and cyber threats, financial and performance reporting requirements, diversity in the workforce, and the impact of rapidly changing technologies.  Guidehouse LLP provides management consulting, technology consulting and risk consulting services to help federal and international government agencies anticipate and address these and other complex challenges.  Guidehouse LLP is one of four organizations to receive the 2014 Malcolm Baldrige National Quality Award. The Baldrige Award is the nations highest Presidential honor for performance excellence, recognizing U.S. organizations for superior quality and world-class results across six categories defined by Baldrige including Leadership, Strategic Planning, Customer Focus, Measurement, Analysis and Knowledge Management, Workforce Focus, and Operations Focus. For more information on our journey to performance excellence, view our winner profile on the NIST website.  It was announced in February of 2018 that Veritas Capital, a leading private equity investment firm had signed a definitive agreement to acquire its US Public Sector business.  Professionals in Guidehouse LLP may be subject to a government security investigation and may need to meet related eligibility requirements for access to classified information. The State and Local Government TC (Technical Capability) Advisory practice provides individuals the opportunity to serve clients in the areas of: business design, organizational strategy, market analysis, financial modeling, operational analysis, process improvement, change management, compliance monitoring, and program management. The application of this skill set within state and local governments is delivering compelling, high impact solutions to our clients' toughest business and technology problems. The team translates strategy into action.Qualifications"Minimum Year(s) of Experience: 5  Minimum Degree Required: Bachelor's degree  Knowledge Preferred:  Demonstrates extensive knowledge and/or a proven record of success in key facets of state and local government, including:  - Education, Housing, Transportation, and/or Administration and functional areas; and, - Strategic sourcing, shared services, economic development, sustainability, performance management, disaster recovery and/or customer contact centers.  Demonstrates extensive knowledge and/or a proven record of success in core management consulting skills and the ability to lead clients through solution development including experience in areas such as application development, system implementation, and QA/QC/IVandV.  Skills Preferred:  Demonstrates extensive-level, abilities success with managing the identification and addressing of client needs in the following areas:  - Demonstrating a blend of technology solution development, functional architecture, and program management skills;- Conducting baseline assessments, building a future state vision, and developing actionable implementation plans;- Preparing concise, accurate documents and maintaining project economics while remaining flexible as unanticipated issues arise;- Managing engagements and client needs;- Leading business development opportunities;- Prioritizing tasks in a client-driven environment;- Providing candid, meaningful feedback in a timely manner;- Keeping leadership informed of progress and issues, and answering questions and offer direction to staff;- Creating a positive environment while managing staff workloads;- Interfacing with organizational managers; - Exhibiting IT implementation skills, specifically with large-scale technology transformation programs (i.e., strategy through execution);- Demonstrating IT strategy skills by being able to develop and document business visions, technology strategies, and project roadmaps;- Demonstrating IT documentation skills in producing technical deliverables through all phases of the SDLC (requirements, business analyses, data-flow diagrams, data models, design);- Communicating knowledge of the SDLC and product and project life cycles by using business analysis and data architecture; and, - Showing extensive program management, communication and presentation skills including the ability to liaise with technical and business teams and clearly articulate technology concepts to business audiences, in order to drive projects to completion.

Name: Lead Analyst COB C/D Recovery
Description: Job Description:COBX Senior Health ServicesSBD Business Performance and FinanceMajor Michigan health insurer located in southeast Michigan seeking experienced Lead Analyst for Medicare business.SUMMARYApplies analytical and leadership skills to manage workflow, track, and report operational performance for COB Part C/D and Recovery activities. Ensure timeliness is met and expected outcomes achieved.Lead the implementation of new processes and policy requirements.Lead the identification of process improvement opportunities. Identify barriers and lead the development of solutions.Support control validation oversight and analyze data to ensure quality and maintain compliance with CMS requirements and BCBSM MA policies.Support vendor oversight and operations for contracted services.Train, coach, and mentor team members. Provide feedback on team performance.Perform data reconciliation.Research and resolve complex inquiries.Execute department functions as needed.Serve as a subject matter expert regarding CMS and BCBSM MA policies related to COB and Recovery. Represent the department on cross departmental work groups and committees.Assist leadership in analyzing data and reporting findings.Perform other related duties as assigned.ADDITIONAL DEPARTMENT JOB DUTIESResearch and validate identified claim overpayments.Support audit concept management process.Support the implementation of claim overpayment recovery and avoidance initiativesADDITIONAL DEPARTMENT REQUIREMENTSStrong working knowledge of claims operations including Medicare billing and reimbursement policy.Working knowledge of Microsoft Access, other Microsoft office applications, and related software programs.Research and validate identified claim overpayments.Support audit concept management process.Support the implmentation of claim overpayment recovery and avoidance initiativesADDITIONAL DEPARTMENT PREFERENCESMedicare professional and facility claim processing experience and/or auditing highly desired.Medicare Advantage plan operations experience is preferred.EDUCATION AND/OR EXPERIENCEBachelor's degree in related field required or equivalent experience including Part C/D plan operations.Four (4) to seven (7) years experience in related field.Knowledge of CMS compliance guidelines and Part C/D COB plan requirements, COB Rules of Primacy, Medicare Secondary Payer (MSP) regulations. Experience establishing MSP coordination periods.Strong organizational, problem solving, verbal and written communication skills.Strong analytical and reporting skills.Ability to work independently, within a team environment and with multiple priorities.Proficient in current industry standard PC applications and systems (e.g., Access, Excel and Word).Ability to train and coach.Ability to lead the implementation of new processes, workflows, and enhance existing operations.Ability to work closely with the technical support team in understanding and resolving systems issues.Ability to develop, implement, and monitor policies and procedures.Familiarity with check posting and payment tracking.QUALIFICATIONSTo perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Name: Data Scientists Analysts
Description: V2Soft (www.v2soft.com) is a global company, headquartered out of Bloomfield Hills, Michigan, with locations in Mexico, Italy, India, China and Germany. At V2Soft, our mission is to provide high performance technology solutions to solve real business problems. We become our customer's true partner, enabling both parties to enjoy success. We are committed to promoting diversity in the workplace, and believe it has a positive effect on our company and the customers we serve. We have an immediate requirement for a Data Scientists Analysts with our client in Dearborn, MI.Required Skills:Description: At Client Data & Analytics organization, we like data - a lot. We are looking for smart, nice, and curious people like you -- people who “get” data, thrive in a fast-paced environment, and have wicked analytic and data science skills. Data Scientist positions discover and curate new and existing data sources to create solutions for the business. These key positions help bring data to life to solve business problems. At times, the problem is identified by a business unit, frequently wishing to optimize cost, revenue, or improve quality, and at times problems are formulated by the Data Scientists. Solutions are then envisioned that harness internal and external data and through visualizations, predictive analytics, and prescriptive methods, providing the ability for users to answer their key questions. Skills Required: You will have the opportunity to work with some of the best and brightest in the field and be at the forefront of the data science movement that is transforming the automotive industry. Support the development and delivery of analytic models using skills such as data acquisition and management, algorithm design, and model development & refinementAcquire deep understanding of the business problems and translate them into appropriate mathematical representationsEncode mathematical abstractions into prototype computer programs or modelsDesigning visual interface for users to interact with the data; Building visualizationsInterpret results and communicate them to technical and non-technical audiences, cross-functional teams and executive leadershipWorking with business on change management, including new process implementationsExperience Required:1+ years of experience (can include classwork) with Data Gathering skills/tools, leveraging tools similar to such as: SQL, Hadoop, Teradata, SAS, Business Objects, etc. 1+ years of experience (can include classwork) with Visualization skills/tools (e.g. QlikView, Tableau, WebFocus,D3, Plotly, etc.)Education Required:Bachelor’s degreeEducation Preferred:Masters DegreeV2Soft Offers market-competitive wages and excellent benefits. https://www.v2soft.com/careers/benefitsMedical, Dental and Vision benefits, which start immediately upon hire.401K Retirement Savings Plan10 Paid Holidays10 Paid Vacation Days annuallyFlexible spendingLong-term and Short-term disability insuranceLife and AD&D insuranceV2Soft is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE).

Excel.Willingness to participate in an on-call rotation 24x7x365.Preferred:Experience with BI tools such as OBIEE, Cognos, etc.Familiar with PL/SQL and relational databases.Project Management experience.Knowledge and Skills:Respond promptly and effectively to problems, projects and tasks.Be organized, with ability to multi-task and prioritize multiple requests.Ability to gain trust of others and builds solid relationships across and vertically throughout the organization and relate well to all customers.Work well with abstract concepts.Apply analytical skills to solve problems creatively.Extract and manipulate large data sets.Ability to convey complex information in a timely and easily understood manner throughout all levels of the organization.Demonstrate initiative by being proactive in work duties and making recommendations as opportunities arise.Self-driven, motivated to help, and able to perform with minimal supervision in a team environment.Customer focused, always having the customer and company's best interest in mind.Company Values: To be successful in this role, Team Members need to demonstrate the characteristics of PRIDE (our Company core values) in their work: Positive: Maintain a positive attitude by focusing on solutions and promoting a collaborative and enjoyable environment.Respectful: Value teamwork, share successes, appreciates others and communicates in a way that promotes trust.Insightful: Make timely well considered decisions, create innovative solutions and continuously learn.Direct: Communicate clearly and objectively; don't be afraid of difficult conversations. Raise concerns through the proper channels.Earnest: Be honest, sincere and consistent. Work hard and pursue our goals together relentlessly.FLSA Classification Status: Exempt Targeted Salary: $55,821.50 - $74,428.67

J.D Power ranked Quicken Loans “Highest in Customer Satisfaction in Primary Mortgage Origination” for the past eight consecutive years, 2010 – 2017. There’s a simple reason we’ve been so successful: We care about the people we work with.  If you’re tired of stuffy, bureaucratic workplaces, then you’ll be delighted to find something different here. We strive to make a creative, fun and collaborative environment you simply won’t find anywhere else. Excellent benefits package that includes a 401(k) match, medical/dental/vision insurance and much moreOpportunities to participate in professional and personal development programs, including personal empowerment coaching, leadership training and ongoing personal growth trainingOther incentives, contests and rewards, including trips, event tickets, cash prizes and more As a Business Consultant Intern, you’ll be a subject matter expert of the business area as you look to find and act upon process improvement ideas. The anti-corporate culture of Quicken Loans gives our team members the initiative to build solutions together and grow both personally and professionally. At Quicken Loans, we’re in the business of putting roofs over our clients’ heads, but we certainly aren’t putting ceilings on our team members’ careers. If you’re interested in working in a place with a philosophy that’s truly different, apply today.  Quicken Loans is an equal opportunity employer. Disclaimer: Quicken Loans received the highest numerical score in the proprietary J.D. Power 2010 – 2016 Primary Mortgage Origination studies and the 2014 – 2017 Primary Mortgage Servicer studies. 2016 Origination (or Sales) based on 5,182 total responses and measures the opinions of customers who originated a new mortgage or refinanced within the past 12 months, surveyed in July – August 2016. 2017 Servicing based on 7,374 total responses and measures the opinions of homeowners on their mortgage servicing company, surveyed in March – April 2017. Your experiences may vary. Visit JDPower.com.Quicken Loans is the #1 online lender based on the ranking of Quicken Loans in comparison to online residential mortgage lenders included in the Inside Mortgage Finance "Top 50 Mortgage Lenders" report from Q2 2017.

Name: Sr. Systems Analyst
Description: Position : Sr. Systems Analyst  Job Duties :  Under limited supervision, analyze moderately complex computer systems/procedures and design solutions using OOAD; provide expertise during system development lifecycle; analyze user requirements, procedures and problems; coordinate with managers to identify/solve problems and clarify objectives; plan and design systems using structured analysis, data modeling, information engineering and advanced theoretical concepts; formulate use case diagrams, flow charts, activity diagrams, sequence diagrams and other models; estimate project implementation and evaluate new tools/technologies; develop business flow and system functional and technical design; analyze workflow and system needs for conversions and migrations; implement SOA architecture; deploy code changes; provide support for existing applications such as troubleshooting, bug fixes, and minor enhancements of existing applications; develop, document and revise design procedures and quality standards; translate requirements into application code/logic and configure hardware and software; develop reports; monitor performance and analyze and tune SQL statements; perform validation; collaborate with project manager for UAT; test, maintain and monitor programs and systems; troubleshoot systems and fix errors; coordinate installation; mentor/assist less experienced teammates; and use: UNIX, Windows, Oracle, SQL Server, TFS, SSRS, Ajax, Silverlight, ServiceNow, CSS, Java Script, HTML, XML, ASP.Net, C#.Net, ADO.Net, Web Services and related tools.  Minimum Qualifications Education :  Master degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Systems or in a related field of study (will accept equivalent foreign degree);  Experience : One (1) year of experience as a Software Developer, Systems Analyst, Programmer or in a related occupation;  Other Requirements :  Experience must include one (1) year of work with UNIX, Oracle, ServiceNow, ADO.Net and C#.Net; must be willing to relocate. Name: BCN Financial Analyst - PFA
Description: BLUE CARE NETWORK OF MICHIGANPROVIDER FINANCIAL ANALYSISFINANCIAL ANALYSTSOUTHFIELD, MI (COMMONS)The Analyst supports reimbursement and audit reporting. Based on unit assignment may be responsible for preparation and analysis of monthly HMO Primary Care Group (PCG) financial statements and other paid claim reports for the BCN product lines, coordination with parent organization (BCBSM) to supply reports for settlement purposes or auditing of paid claims to ensure payments are made per contractual language and complicated reimbursement audits. Support Provider Affairs department by producing detailed ad-hoc reports to assist in management of PCG members or assist with other facility audits to ensure claims are paid at the contracted rate.REIMBURSEMENT AND AUDIT:Analyze and report to BCBSM PHA hospital payments for discounted or unique arrangements to ensure accurate settlement of claims. Analyze and audit claim payments and payment mechanisms produced by the Facets claims system. Perform fee schedule impact analysis for modeling purposes and decision making; re-price claims due to retro-active pricing updates. Analyze, research, develop and implement new reimbursement methods. Assist in User Acceptance Testing of new reimbursements to assure appropriate payouts are made. Represent department on corporate workgroups and meetings. Other duties may be assigned. Bachelor's Degree in Business Administration, Finance, Accounting, Computer Science or related field. Two (2) years systems analyses experience required which includes one year (1) year of medical claim systems configuration and/or pricing analyses.One (1) year experience using diagnosis and procedure coding systems (for example CPT, MUPC, HCPCS and ICD-9) with regard to hospital or medical claims billing and processing.One (1) year database management software and PC experience. Ability to perform detailed financial analysis, complex pricing, system research/analysis, reconciliation, provide solutions and/or develop audit reports.High degree of complex evaluative, analysis and problem solving.Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite software (Access, Excel, and Word) required Business Object and Facets preferred.Excellent verbal and written communication skills.Knowledge of HMO procedures preferred.Thorough understanding of managed care physician provider reimbursement and risk funding arrangements preferred.Detailed knowledge of claims, pricing, benefits and provider mainframe computer systems required, including BCN mainframe claims subsystem (Facets) interaction preferred.Knowledge of funding arrangements between BCN and IPAs preferred.Demonstrated knowledge of claim processing system analysis and configuration preferred.Other duties may be assigned.DEPARTMENT REQUIREMENTS:Working knowledge of health care Facility claims processing.Beginning to intermediate experience using Access concepts with the ability to pull and manipulate data.Beginning to intermediate working ability to summarize large volumes of data using Excel.DEPARTMENT PREFERENCES:Experience in claims auditing.Knowledge of Commercial products.Ability to understand how claims are billed, including reimbursement process.Understanding of Facets configuration.Financial related experience and provider contracting experience.All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to, among other grounds, race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, gender identity, protected veteran status or status as an individual with a disability.

Name: Ford GDI&A Data Operations Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionJob Description/Overview: Ford Motor Company's Global Data, Insight, and Analytics (GDI&A) organization is looking for a highly skilled Data Operations Analyst in the customer domain. You will assist in the development of and operationally manage consistent repeatable processes to curate customer data, allowing Ford Motor Company to build intelligent customer insights.  The Data Operations team is responsible for creating data standards, assessing data quality, and ensuring data availability to fully support the goals of GDI&A. Responsibilities:Execute Fords Customer Data Strategy including maintaining and improving the quality of Ford Motor Company customer data.Facilitate cross-functional communication between areas throughout the organization that collect, maintain, and use data related to Ford customers to determine data-related requirements and priorities.Partner with IT to deliver data solutions required to support the enterprise by documenting business rules for processing and storing data, testing database changes, and monitoring data flows for quality assurance.Perform root cause analysis and investigation on data quality issues and work with the business owners and IT to fix the issues.Develop and document the processes to standardize data management operations at Ford by collaborating with internal Global, Data, Insight & Analytics teams, IT, and business units.Serve as a customer data subject matter expert and demonstrate an understanding of key data management principles and data use.Develop/enhance/monitor data quality reports to identify potential issues with production data flows.Job RequirementsBasic Qualifications:Bachelors degree is required5+ years of experience in a data management role including running queries and compiling data for analyticsPreferred Qualifications:Experience writing complex database queries against Teradata, DB2, SQL Server and HadoopKnowledge of data management standards, data governance practices and data quality principlesAbility to quickly comprehend the functions and capabilities of new technologiesKnowledge of Data Stage/ETL and MDM concepts is desirableUnderstanding of the importance of data and the data strategy needed to support analytic developmentRequires the ability to partner effectively with IT to deliver technological solutions required to support the needs of Global, Data, Insight & AnalyticsSelf-starter, high level of initiative, detail-oriented and ability to multi-taskStrong problem formulation and problem solving skills, with the ability to communicate in a clear and succinct mannerSuccessful candidate must be able to demonstrate leadership behaviors combined with outstanding interpersonal, collaboration, and communication skills The distance between imagination and creation. It can be measured in years of innovation, or in moments of brilliance. When you join the Ford team discover all the benefits, rewards and development opportunities youd expect from a diverse global leader. Youll become part of a team that is already leading the way, with ingenious solutions and attainable products and it is always ready to go further. Name: Financial Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionFinancial Analyst Responsible for assisting the controller managing all financial and accounting functions of the business unit. Looking for an energetic finance business partner with an in-depth finance expertise, with an interest in evolving in a manufacturing industry in a fast-paced environment. Possibility to evolve to a controller position in a 3 to 5 year time frame. Responsibilities: • Assist in the preparation of monthly financial statements, quarterly and annual and any other analysis required by management  • Assist in the preparation of budgets and financial forecasts  • Responsible of the cost accounting section & the in depth analysis of manufacturing expenses.  • Support as required the marketing group in their Bid effort.  • Prepare TINA packages for government proposals.  • Work directly with DCAA/DCMA offices.  • Ensure that internal controls comply with company policies and procedures and ensure their effectiveness or improvements to internal controls.  • Prepare, analyze and develop performance indicators, makes recommendations to the management team and track their implementation once approved  • Responsible for the collection and management of accounts receivable  • Coordinate inventory cycle count on a monthly basis  • Participate to the implementation of the ERP system'  • Perform other duties as assigned by the Controller  • Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed Required Skills:  • The candidate must be highly motivated, hands-on, with strong computer skills and a good knowledge of manufacturing environments.  • The candidate must be results oriented and enjoy challenges.  • The candidate must have good accounting knowledge, very good analytical skills as well as knowledge of the Microsoft Office suite above average.  • The candidate must be a good communicator and have good interpersonal skills while promoting teamwork.  • The candidate has the ability to solve practical problems through problem definition, data collection and the establishment of valid conclusions.  • The candidate must have a sense of urgency to meet deadlines and resolving outstanding issues.  • The candidate must be confident but should not hesitate to ask questions and seek to complete its work  • The candidate in this position would be in a good position to evolve to a controller position in a 3 to 5 year time frame. Qualifications: • Masters degree in accounting or related field  • CPA or in the process to obtain the CPA Experience in the manufacturing industry (an asset)  • Strong skills in Excel and in the Microsoft Office suitesCompany DescriptionSTART - Specialized Talent Acquisition Recruiting Team. We offer 24/7 staffing services to the Metro Detroit Area.
