Name: Pricing Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionUniversal Logistics Holdings, Inc. (ULH), is a leading edge asset-light logistics provider. We offer a comprehensive suite of supply chain solutions providing transportation, value-added, intermodal, and specialized services across the globe. Universal's experienced management team, with its state-of-the-art technology, provides customized logistics solutions to its customers resulting in proven efficiencies and savings. Currently, Universal is seeking Pricing Analyst candidates for our transportation operations.  The Pricing Analyst will be a pivotal point of contact for executive staff on rate and carrier information. They will be implementing and maintaining a new data set that will provide detailed reports on daily rates, freight movement, and revenue. They will design and supply daily and weekly dashboards and assist sales with identifying key performance indicators. They will be retrieving data from multiple programs and consolidating it into these dashboards. They will play a key part in helping grow and expand our business.Responsibilities and Requirements include, but are not limited to:Conduct analysis of revenue and profitability to determine optimal price levels.Process, analyze, and submit complex freight network bid packages.Monitor market trends, completive pricing strategies, and assist Sales/Operations through the creation and modeling of solutions.Establishing internal pricing requests and making recommendations to increase profitability.Prepare and distribute pricing performance reports tracking revenue and profit trends.Provide accurate and timely responses to customer’s rate requests.Recommend improvements to the various pricing processes, assist in the organization, development and evaluation of forward-thinking strategies that optimize pricing.Provide upper management with ad hoc business reportsKnowledge and understanding of the transportation industry.An ideal applicant should exhibit the following skill set:1-2+ years of experience in Transportation and/or PricingBachelor’s Degree in a business related concentration (Preferred)Effective oral and written communication skillsProblem solving and analytical skills, as well as a strong attention to detailProficient in data organizing in Microsoft Excel (v-lookup, pivot tables, etc.) and AccessAbility to work in a fast paced environmentStrong project management skills. Ability to handle multiple tasks at once, prioritize tasks and meet deadlines We offer a competitive base salary and benefits package including major medical, dental, 401K, and vacation in addition to offering upward mobility within the company. If you are an energetic, self-motivated individual with the drive to become part of a growing organization, do not hesitate, respond today!  Check us out on the web at: www.universallogistics.com!Company DescriptionUniversal Logistics Holdings is a full-service provider of customized transportation and logistics solutions. For over 80 years, we have provided complete services including dry van and specialized transportation, intermodal drayage, material handling and value-added services, and global trade management.  Universal's experienced management team, with its state-of-the-art technology, provides customized logistics solutions to its customers resulting in proven efficiencies and savings.

Name: Supply Chain Analyst
Description: Position Summary: A Supply Chain Analyst will maintain solutions as it relates to the customer agreement and may recommend and implement changes to improve efficiency, provide cost savings or reduce support. Position will require customer interactions and be capable of representing Penske in customer meetings. A Penske Supply Chain Analyst will work collectively between Operations, Engineering and Technology to support logistics solutions and strategic cost savings opportunities. The Supply Chain Analyst is responsible for managing Transportation Management business processes including shipment route plan optimization and execution to ensure that Penske’s solutions are meeting customer requirements. Major Responsibilities: - Analyzes route schedules or load plans, historical activity and customer trends in order to provide recommendations for improvements to routing efficiency and solution effectiveness  - Support the design and implementation of a developed supply chain solution  - Identify cost savings opportunities for the customer  - Handle reoccurring analysis and tasks driving continuous cost savings initiatives  - Examine current processes and implement or recommend improvements to drive out waste  - Proactively monitor and manage key performance indicators and execute root cause analysis utilizing TM operating systems  - Interact with customers in resolving problems and coordinating implementations  - Develop and distribute weekly customer metrics and develop customer performance reports  - Meet customer deadlines and develop metrics dashboards that highlight customer specific analytics  - Develop and assist with presenting customer analytics, key trends and solution proposals during customer QBR's  - Applies network changes and synchronizes execution with TM system  - Maps and documents standard operating processes  - Applies tactical processes daily within the established business rules.  - Use discretion and independent judgment to answer customer requests and propose solutions  - Work with internal subject matter expert to resolve problems and support implementations  - Follow processes that are set by engineering and help implement any process changes and transportation design changes  - Other projects and tasks as assigned by supervisor- 1 - 4 year comparable work experience  - Bachelor's Degree preferred: Business Administration, Logistics & Supply Chain Management preferred Fundamental understanding of transportation, supply chain and logistics conceptsStrong written and oral communication skillsAdvanced problem solving skillsAbility to work effectively in a team environmentAbility to work independently with minimum supervisionExperience analyzing large sets of dataCandidate must possess computer skills to include: Access, Excel, Microsoft Word, Outlook and PowerPointConsistently demonstrates proven ability to learn and use necessary toolsAbility to follows process and standard proceduresRegular, predictable, full attendance is an essential function of the jobWillingness to travel as necessary, work the required schedule, work at the specific location required, complete Penske employment application, submit to a background investigation (to include past employment, education, and criminal history) and drug screening are required.Physical Requirements:The physical and mental demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an associate to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.The associate will be required to: read; communicate verbally and/or in written form; remember and analyze certain information; and remember and understand certain instructions or guidelines.While performing the duties of this job, the associate may be required to stand, walk, and sit. The associate is frequently required to use hands to touch, handle, and feel, and to reach with hands and arms. The associate must be able to occasionally lift and/or move up to 25lbs/12kg.Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and the ability to adjust focus.Penske is an Equal Opportunity Employer.About Penske Logistics Penske Logistics is a wholly owned subsidiary of Penske Truck Leasing. With operations in North America, South America, Europe and Asia, Penske Logistics provides supply chain management and logistics services to leading companies around the world. Penske Logistics delivers value through its design, planning and execution in transportation, warehousing and freight management. Visit www.PenskeLogistics.com to learn more.

Name: Digital Analyst
Description: Digital Optimization Analyst, Livonia, MI, 3/22/17, Direct Hire  Overview  iVantage Group which is one of Michigans fastest growing Staffing and Direct Placement firms is currently searching for qualified Digital Optimization Analyst with experience in the following: Bachelors degree, in Business, Marketing, Technology, or related discipline.Expert user of SQL and Excel.3+ years of digital strategy/research/analysis experience. Position: Digital Optimization Analyst  Industry: Information Technology  Employee Benefits: Comprehensive Benefit Plan  Responsibilities / Job Description:  The Digital Optimization Analyst designs and implements campaign analytics, reporting and insights in order to evaluate digital campaign performance. Collaborates with team members and external partners to design and execute fact-based continuous improvement and channel growth strategies using online and offline data analysis techniques with the goal of developing actionable insights.  This role requires strong analytic skills and a keen knowledge of digital marketing from technology, creative and consumer engagement aspects. Technical expertise is key, with demonstrated business/financial modeling capabilities using tools such as Excel, SQL, etc. The ideal candidate will be able to apply statistical analysis principles to business challenges, then interpret data and present learnings that can be used to obtain business objectives. Analyze multi-channel campaign data (online, phone) from multiple sources/databases using SQL to evaluate campaign metrics (email, display, paid search, etc.) and sales performance (leads, applications, sales, etc.).Interpret online campaign data, and present it in a meaningful way that leads to insightful dialogue and actionable recommendations.Support the Direct Sales Unit in Omaha by providing reports and data related to agent performance.Develop reports and ad hoc analyses that help to understand phone system traffic patterns, identify differences among our customer groups, online usage behaviors and recognize opportunities for campaign improvements.Leads and participates in discussions with stakeholders to define digital requirements, development needs, and measurable marketing objectives for interactive marketing campaigns. Develop strong relationships with internal and external parties alike and is viewed as an Analytic SME.Design marketing tests. Report on test results. Determine the significance of the results. Write test reports and determine next steps.Conduct online advertising, search and email campaign data analysis design and develop reporting based on the needs of the business.Collaborate with digital marketing team to understand campaign goals, aligning messaging with campaign activity and providing ongoing measurement on effectiveness of campaigns.Assist in new campaign setup by creating URLs and historical documentation regarding campaign launches and testing design. Develop pre-project measurement plans based on established KPIs in order to develop specific and actionable recommendations. Skills Experience with various tracking methodologies used for digital campaigns.Experience with Salesforce.Ability to work productively in a team environment. Contact Tom Csatari: tcsatari@theivantagegroup.com or 810-225-8520 ext 102  About iVantage Group  iVantage Group is a nationally recognized provider of staffing services and project based solutions located in Brighton, Michigan. Recipient of Crains Detroit Business Best Places to Work award along with being one of Inc. 500s Fasting Growing Firms in the United States. Certified as a Minority & Women Owned Business Enterprise we excel at finding exceptional talent that cant be found. Our 24/7/365 real time recruiting engine is state of the art and has allowed our organization to obtain elite vendor status at local clients such as BCBSM, HAP, General Motors, OnStar, Flagstar, Comerica, Delta Dental, Consumers Energy, Jackson National Life, and Carhartt. We provide our consultants with long term Contract, Contract-to-Hire and Permanent Placement services. Simply put we will take your career to the next level!  For more information on iVantage Group please visit us at www.theivantagegroup.com .

Name: SAP WM Analyst
Description: Job Description***PLEASE NOTE APPLICATION RULES, POLICY GUIDELINES AT BOTTOM OF POSTING BEFORE APPLYING TO ENSURE YOUR APPLICATION CAN BE PROCESSED AND CONSIDERED.DUTIES: You will be responsible for: (1) Acting as the resident supply chain Subject Matter Expert (SME) specifically owning IT SAP WM modules; (2) IT SAP WM architecture, design, implementation, integration, configuration, maintenance, support, etc.; (3) Leading IT and supply chain solutions evaluation through implementation efforts; (4) Acting in an advisory capacity to the supply chain functional community, and leading IT efforts for SAP WM solutions as well as non-SAP solutions; (5) Acting as a supply chain business/functional process thought leader, evangelist, Subject Matter Expert with dual expertise in IT SAP WM solutions architecture, integration, implementation, and support. REQUIRED: You are currently located in the US, and are a SAP WM SOLUTIONS ARCHITECT and SUPPLY CHAIN business/functional process Subject Matter Expert (SME) as your CORE scope of responsibility, yet NOT as a career contractor/consultant. You also own the SAP WM from a corporate IT perspective as well as from a supply chain perspective as the face to the supply chain community on a day to day basis.  MUST have 10+ years of IT, SAP, and supply chain industry experience but NOT as a career contractor or consultant. Career contractors or consultants who go from end-client to end-client or consulting firm to consulting firm or project to project can NOT be considered for this role.  MUST have STRONG/CURRENT business/functional process supply chain experience NOT purely garnered through SAP projects. Functional supply chain experience garnered as a consultant or contractor on a project by project basis is too limited, superficial, and novice based to be considered as relevant.  MUST have 8+ years of STRONG/CURRENT SAP WM experience as an analyst, configurator, lead, solutions architect, and WM/Supply Chain point person to the business/stakeholder community as a member of a corporate IT organization, with VERY deep and wide SUPPLY CHAIN business process and functional expert.  MUST have STRONG/CURRENT SAP WM production support experience as well as the ability to read and debug ABAP.  MUST come from a small to medium corporate IT departments---experience from large IT organizations will NOT suffice as the skill-set will be too narrow, or siloed, or splintered.  You are NOT an SAP project manager or manager as your core scope of responsibility but do have STRONG initiative leadership and project management skills.  MUST have EXCELLENT communications (verbal & written), interpersonal, relationship development, organizational, presentation, and persuasion skills. Pluses: CRM; mobile; analytics; retail. APPLICATION PROCESS AND CRITERIA:***Only applicants currently residing within the US can be considered. Applicants from outside of the US cannot be considered for this role.***This is a FULL-TIME W2 corporate IT employment opportunity with salary/bonus/benefits. This is NOT a consulting or contracting role nor can resumes from consulting firms be considered.****RESUMES WITH COMPLETE FULL CONTACT INFORMATION INCLUDING FULL NAME, FULL RESIDENTIAL ADDRESS, PHONE NUMBER, AND EMAIL ADDRESS CAN ONLY BE CONSIDERED IN ORDER TO FULFILL FEDERAL EOE AND AUDIT COMPLIANCE POLICY AND PROCESS. RESUMES WITHOUT THIS REQUIRED INFORMATION WILL NOT BE CONSIDERED.****LINKEDIN "RESUMES" CANNOT BE CONSIDERED AS THEY LACK THE NECESSARY CONTACT INFORMATION AND DO NOT PROVIDE THE NECESSARY SUBSTANCE FOR EVALUATION AND PROCESSING. APPLICANTS WHO USE THE LINKEDIN VERSION OF A RESUME WILL NOT BE ABLE TO BE CONSIDERED FOR EMPLOYMENT FOR THE ROLE THEY APPLY FOR.****The online questionnaire associated with this role MUST be completed fully. Applicants who do not complete this questionnaire cannot be considered.Company DescriptionLaka & Company is a firm that specializes in helping firms identify, attract, hire, retain, and develop the best possible talent for the Accounting/Finance, Executive Leadership, Human Resource/HR/Talent Acquisition, IT/Technology, Manufacturing/Logistics/Supply Chain, Marketing, and Operations marketplace.  We are able to provide strategic and tactical professionals to the 'C' level office and we perform contingency, container, and retainer based search projects.  We also help firms evaluate their workflow, process, and interview methodology and help them identify areas that can be improved upon, areas that are performing exceptionally well, and create unique metrics more core to the candidate experience to provide feedback that has been missing historically.  Much can be done to make the hiring experience more rewarding, satisfying, effective, competitive, and successful for all parties involved and that is where we come in.  We create a win-win for the employer, and the employment candidates by helping drive process improvement and adaption of competitive hiring "best practices". By helping firms perform more effectively while introducing them to candidates they cannot normally approach on their own, we create a formula and process that truly raises the bar on quality and prompt hiring.  Helping our clients change, evolve, and perform at higher standards is a very rewarding experience---especially when it benefits the entire organization and the candidate's hiring experience which in today's social media world, is essential and critical.  It's also respectful and courteous, and the way it should be done.  And that makes our whole existence worthwhile!

Name: IT Analyst
Description: Responsible for all activities related to technical solutions, physician practice customer service and acceptable service levels within the Ambulatory project teams in support of initiatives for our physician practices. Provide technical expertise to all project initiatives in the population health support space for the Beaumont Medical Group and independent practice community along with improved transparency and visibility to the customer. Provide business side knowledge related to Disease Registries, Population Health and quality and payor incentive programs along with the technical expertise related to the IT components to support the build and submission of these registry metrics for the physician community.  Essential Duties:  1. Provide business side knowledge related to Disease Registries, Population Health and quality and payor incentive programs along with the technical expertise related to the IT components to support the build and submission of these registry metrics for the physician community.  2. Provide business side knowledge related to Meaningful Use, MACRA/MIPS and other quality and payor incentive programs along with the technical expertise related to the IT components to support the build and submission of these measures for the physician community  3. Participate in some phases of the system development life cycle with guidance from senior level colleagues  4. Assist users to identify current operating procedures and clarify business objectives  5. Apply application/system knowledge to develop solutions to meet business/customer requirements, compare and evaluate options and recommend appropriate course of action with guidance from senior level colleagues  6. Assist in writing detailed description of users' business needs, program functions and steps required to develop or modify systems under general guidance  7. Analyze, design, build, code/configure, test, debug, and document all activities to support implementing and maintaining application systems under general direction  8. Assist in testing all aspects of a solution including correct results, integration, data and system integrity  9. Assure quality of work by coordinating review prior to implementation with appropriate written documentation  10. Recognize and advise leadership of concerns and/or issues, and provide appropriate follow up to identified issues  11. Create and maintain technical application documentation including test plans, application architecture diagrams, data flows, use cases and workflow  12. Participate in training the end users, providing 24 x 7 customer support and assisting colleagues  13. Participate in an on-call rotation to provide off-hours end user support where applicable  Standard Qualifications Education: Bachelor's Degree in IT or Nursing with Quality/Regulatory experience and IT experience preferred Technical Skills: Epic Certified, Ambulatory certification preferred Work Experience: 1 -2+ years' experience in IT and solid understanding of payor incentive programs, federal regulatory programs, chronic disease registries

Name: Connected Vehicle Carrier Planning Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionPosition Overview/Description: The Connected Vehicle Carrier Planning position offers an exciting opportunity to contribute to the development and implementation of connected vehicle services that will be used by Ford vehicle customers around the world. You will be directly responsible for managing the mobile network carrier relationships that Ford maintains on a global scale.  We are looking for a seasoned cellular engineer/project manager, contract manager and strategic leader to guide multidisciplinary connected vehicle team members to envision and design future experiences (DAS System management, contracts, new technologies) in and around connected vehicles. You will collaborate with connected vehicle and cellular resources to frame the right questions and on research programs that lead us to new insights. With your creative and analytical mind, you will use key insights to frame new opportunity spaces and guide the experience vision for our future global customers. You will guide and oversee all cellular connectivity throughout the process. You will relentlessly advocate a human centric perspective through all stages of the design process. As a team player, you will create impact by collaborating across the Ford organization and with key work partners throughout the company product, marketing, engineering and technology teams.  The Ford Global Carrier Planning Team is a growing team committed to envisioning and creating simple, thoughtful, enjoyable and compelling product experiences that continually inspire our teams and customers to go further.  Our diverse Carrier Planning Team situated in greater Detroit and Shanghai - is comprised of cellular analysts, cellular engineers and technical project managers. Together our team works to understand our changing world, identify new opportunities, and take action to design and innovate for the future of mobility Fords vehicles and surrounding experiences. Responsibilities:Contribute to the creation, submission and review of responses to RFIs and RFPs to vendors (Cellular Carriers, emerging technology startups in the cellular space, etc.)Provide recommendations and direction on support of present and emerging technologies affecting the industry in terms of vehicle connectivity (5G, eUICC, V2X, DSRC, etc.)Support M2M data forecasting, reconciliation, and analysis as well as deployment of features to new regionsManage Site Surveys of manufacturing plants and other required facilities to support EOL provisioning and lite testing, as well as Ford test facilities requiring enhanced coverageAct as the SPOC point of contact for carrier related inquiries from all areas within Ford (Product Development, Application Development, etc.)Provide recommendations of Cellular Carriers to support present and future market regions aligning with Fords business strategyCollaborate with IT Contracts and CV&S to determine requirements for Carrier contracts and amendmentsFacilitate and manage carrier governance by assigning accountability and following up for completion of itemsAssist in the integration of current and future launch regions into the Global Carrier help deskProvide budget forecasts as required to support projects as well as ongoing data consumption activitiesManage cycle plan with CarriersManage Carrier PO renewalsProvide Status updates as required to Ford teams including Ford management for all the activities that pertain to this positionAny other IT-related work that is required to support Connected Vehicle (including Mobility Experiments)Job Requirements:Basic Qualifications:Bachelor's Degree10+ years of experience with Connected Vehicle environment (understanding of cloud architecture, SDN, cellular modems)10+ years Business analyst experience, including generating requirements documents, statements of work, and other artifacts to support the above Carrier deliverables10+ years of experience developing and understanding solution architecture diagrams or BIMs10+ years of Cellular Networking expertise & Connected vehicle industry experience.Preferred Qualifications:Experience in Connected Vehicle industryUnderstanding and familiarity with IT Contracts and the contract process at FordAbility to define processes to support the above Carrier deliverablesExperience giving presentations to upper level management reviews on technical and/or vendor assessmentsAbility to work with multiple teams and vendors to complete tasks in a timely fashionFamiliarity with cellular service providersKnowledge on new cellular technologiesFamiliarity with vehicle telematicsStrong communication and presentation skillsStrong skills in collaboratively working with others (including cross-functional teams)Strong planning and organizational skillsStrong skills in creating plans and following up on tasks to ensure on-time deliveryStrong technical leadershipBig picture view and understanding to match Business and IT requirementsSelf-starter and willing to learn in the fast and dynamic fieldExperience with Vendor relationship management The distance between imagination and . Creation. It can be measured in years of innovation, or in moments of brilliance. And, it can be a road you start traveling right now. When you join Ford Motor Company, your journey begins. You become part of a team that is already leading the way, with ingenious solutions and attainable products and it is always ready to go further.  Candidates for positions with Ford Motor Company must be legally authorized to work in the United States. Verification of employment eligibility will be required at the time of hire. Visa sponsorship is not available for this position.  Ford Motor Company is an equal opportunity employer committed to a culturally diverse workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, age, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability status or protected veteran status. Ford Motor Company also is committed to take affirmative action to employ and advance in employment such persons

It can be measured in years of innovation, or in moments of brilliance. When you join the Ford team, discover all the benefits, rewards and development opportunities you'd expect from a diverse global leader. You'll become part of a team that is already leading the way, with ingenious solutions and attainable products - and it is always ready to go further. Name: CRE Credit Analyst
Description: Our Commercial Real Estate Group has an excellent entry level position available for an individual looking to gain more experience in the commercial real estate lending field. With your high GPA, bachelor's degree, and experience through finance/accounting related internships and classes, you will:  Gather and analyze all financial and business information to determine credit worthiness for loans.  Prepare a written evaluation of borrowers' financial condition and future outlook, as well as identify strengths and risks associated with our relationship sponsors and guarantors.  Obtain and follow up on all required documents.  Monitor financial reporting requirements and obtain and analyze financial and loan information.  This position generally leads to a career in commercial real estate lending, either as a portfolio manager or relationship manager, and will include sales in either position. Basic Qualifications: Bachelor's Degree in Business, Accounting, Finance or related field required; a 3.5 GPA or greater is strongly preferred.  Proficiency with Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint and internet resources. Additional Items: Related internship/work experience in finance or banking preferred.  Related internship/work experience in a Commercial Real Estate environment preferred.  Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including grammar and demeanor, required.  Confidence, assertiveness, professionalism, and ability to interact with all levels of the organization.  This position will require successful completion of Huntington's Credit College (3 consecutive weeks in Columbus, Ohio) in a timeframe designated by management.  The position may require periodic travel throughout Huntington's footprint.  Strong organizational skills with attention to detail, planning, and follow-up.  Excellence in customer service, highly motivated, focused and goal oriented.  Ability to work independently and in groups on multiple tasks without compromising quality.  May fill as Senior Credit Analyst based on experience EEO/AA Employer/Minority/Female/Disability/Veteran/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity Tobacco-Free Hiring Practice: Visit Huntington's Career Web Site for more details. Name: Pharmacy Regulatory Analyst
Description: GENERAL SUMMARY:Under general supervision of departmental director or manager performs a variety of database and reporting activities to ensure HFHS continues to be eligible for the 340B federal discount program. Principle duties include: reviewing pharmacy/hospital prescriptions for 340B eligibility, updating records and departmental processes and maintaining compliance with Henry Ford Hospital’s 340B program.PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:On a daily basis, pulls all the adjudicated pharmacy prescriptions that were deemed  non-340B eligible and reviews every single prescription by going through all six filters to  determine eligibility and prevent diversion. By using the electronic medical record  system (EPIC), researches patient encounters within the allotted time frame and finds  the specific medication prescribed, while ensuring that Henry Ford is holding the  records for these patients. Documents and identifies whether the encounter was with a  Henry Ford physician. Pulls the list from the OPA database and checks for eligible  location. Checks Medicaid status of prescriptions to avoid duplicate discounts.Evaluates patient eligibility for qualified and non-qualified patients in mixed-use areas  and clinics by reviewing patient medical records, insurance plans and hospital status.Monitors and audits state Medicaid prescriptions to ensure compliance to prevent  potential duplicate discount rebates  Performs audits on a scheduled basis; may involve presenting and resolving  reconciliation issues as they arise during the monitoring and reconciliation process.Tracks and monitors all payments received by contract pharmacies.Prepares weekly reports reflecting all purchase orders and wholesaler invoices for  finance department  Responsible for relaying any and all issues between contract pharmacies and split  billing software.Addresses any issues with claims, carving out and ensures diversion  and double discount do not occur.Maintains and updates physician and resident files on a monthly basis, accounting for  any provider status changes, updated NPI numbers and removing terminated providers.Notifies split billing software of all payments received from contract pharmacies.Maintains/tracks list of invoices and amounts that are being withheld.Provides financial department with details for amount payable to other covered entities  Is involved in all 340B audits, internal and external  Performs monthly audits of contract pharmacies.Ensures compliance with 340B program requirements for qualified patients, drugs and  locations.Develops a thorough understanding of the split-billing system and the functions to be  performed.Develops reports that can be used to educate staff and assist management in tracking  the overall financial impact of the organization.Build other reports to monitor and  improve 340B program compliance and performance  Maintains copies of reports for compliance and audit purposes.Collaborates with the pharmacies and compliance team to develop monthly, quarterly  and yearly audit metrics  Monitors, reports and analyzes contract pharmacy 340B activities.Conducts on-site training for contract pharmacies if needed.Assists in updating policies and procedures.Uploads spreadsheets and sample audits in the 340B compliance tool.Conducts on-site mock audits with consulting firm.Visits contracted pharmacies and  audits 340B eligible scripts for contract pharmacies as well as our own ambulatory ones.Assists in desktop audits by gathering all information needed, including scripts,  signature logs and labels.Acts as a liaison between pharmacy and patient if additional  information is needed.Expands professional development through related classes and seminars, current  publications and regional/national association membership participation. Processes charity care applications for patients that are in need of assistance.Develops and maintains departmental database including the creation and updating of  database structures, relationships, and populations of files with accurate and current  data in both a PC based and client-server environment.Acts as a departmental liaison to other departments, especially Corporate Information  Services, to enhance the system-wide integration of departmental information system.Communicates with end users to determine project needs, develop specifications, and  update status as needed.Other information systems related duties and responsibilities as assigned or defined.EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE:High School Diploma required.A minimum of one year experience in pharmacy operations required.2 years of college coursework preferred.Pharmacy Technician Licensure preferred.Familiarity with the 340B program preferred.Proficient with Microsoft Office, especially Microsoft Access, Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint.Business/Professional written and verbal communication skills required, as well as interpersonal skills needed to relate with a variety of end-users.Analytical ability required to plan and develop information system projects and to recommend revisions to operational activities if/when appropriate.Excellent project planning and time management skills in order to prioritize and coordinate timely completion of concurrent projects.

Name: IT Service Change Management Process and Tools Analyst (Re-Entry)
Description: Job DescriptionPosition Overview/Description:Fords re-entry program is a temporary assignment for those with an extended employment break (2 or more years) in their field who are looking to re-launch their careers. This is a supplemental position with provisions and benefits different from a regular full-time position. All positions have a six-month duration. Upon successful completion of the program, a full-time employment offer could be made. The Change Analyst role supports ongoing change activities across multiple organizations and a major project to upgrade the existing internally developed change tool (GICC) to an internally hosted vendor (BMC) solution. Responsibilities:Participate in business requirements gathering and support the solution design through various phases of transition from the GICC change tool to BMC Change.Provide BMC Change application support tasks. Act as a liaison between Ford and BMC Managed Service team in providing user supportDevelop and maintain training documentation that will be used to train the users as more teams transition to the new BMC Change tool.Lead remote training sessions for Change process and usage of BMC Change in all global regionsProvide data analysis and review with Change Management process Supervisor/Owner/ChampionServe as the Point of Contact for Global BMC Change customers, facilitate enrollments, and provide guidance on the process and procedures.Assist in generating monthly KPI reports and any ad hoc reports requested by customersAssist in producing monthly Change Process Summary Report and provide the analysis on the problem areas to the leadership team. Engage Service/Functional Managers as necessary and obtain details behind the KPI statusProvide day-to-day support, recommendations and guidance to teams globally to aid in the successful execution of Change ManagementThis position will work in a team setting and works closely with other members on the teamJob Requirements:Basic Qualifications:Bachelors Degree3+ years experience in IT and familiarity with ITIL processesPreferred Qualifications:Strong written and verbal communication skills with attention to detail and qualityITIL certification, Familiarity with Change Management processMicrosoft Office (PowerPoint, Excel) and SharePoint skillsQuick starter to troubleshoot/resolve incidents and business support itemsExcellent interpersonal and communication skills for working in a global environment and able to work with remote resourcesStrong analytical and problem solving skillsAbility to learn new technologies and methodologies quickly and multi-task effectively The distance between imagination and creation. It can be measured in years of innovation, or in moments of brilliance. When you join the Ford team, you discover all the benefits, rewards and development opportunities youd expect from a diverse global leader. Youll become part of a team that is already leading the way, with ingenious solutions and attainable products and it is always ready to go further. Name: Clinical Data Analyst II
Description: POSITION PURPOSEApplies statistical techniques and quantitative methods in reviewing data to investigate the distribution and potential causes of various clinical conditions. Serves as a business intelligence consultant to various department leaders in providing advanced technical and analytic support for strategic and clinical initiatives across all care environments within Trinity Health (Acute Care, Continuing Care, Medical Group and Provider Services, and Community Health and Well Being). This includes developing scorecards, benchmarking studies, and integrated ad hoc analyses focused on improving patient outcomes. In addition to analytic skills, this role requires experience in integrating and preparing large varied datasets from multiple data sources and consolidating the data to be able to draw conclusions from the data to supporting and communicate results with clinical and operational stakeholders. Contributes and participates with other teams including Clinical Informatics, Data Governance and Warehouse, Supply Chain, Revenue, Finance, and Operational Excellence as needed to provide insights for strategic initiatives to senior leaders across the system. Supports analytic design, data collection, and measure reporting are in accordance with national and professional society standards and support various clinical initiatives aligned with achievement of the triple aim. The areas include, but are not limited to, evidence-based medicine and clinical outcomes, predictive analytics, patient safety and adverse events reporting, patient throughput, and financial incentive or penalty forecasts for payer performance measures.ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONSKnows, understands, incorporates and demonstrates the Trinity Health Mission, Vision, and Values in behaviors, practices and decisions.  Maintains a working knowledge of applicable federal, state and local laws and regulations, Trinity Health Organizational Integrity Program, standards of, as well as other policies and procedures in order to ensure adherence in a manner that reflects honest, ethical and professional behavior.  Serves as a subject matter expert by providing guidance and problem solving solutions. Provides analytic strategic consultation in collaboration with clinical and senior leaders in the department in identifying analytic options and opportunities in supporting the project goals.  Researches measure definitions, algorithms, published journal articles, quality programs, and statistical methods to make appropriate recommendations to support goals.  May design and build data collection tools or surveys to be able to analyze the incidence and prevalence of various clinical conditions to guide clinical leaders to opportunities aimed at improving both patient and community outcomes supporting the healthcare triple aim  Develops queries to source high-volume, high-dimensionality data from multiple complex databases. Cleans and manipulates data as appropriate for report generation, dashboard creation, or moderately complex statistical analysis.  Comfortable working with data in the capacity of a programmer.  Regularly monitors performance of many key performance indicators, highlights trends, examines interactions in metrics, and identifies opportunities for improvements to leaders and stakeholders.  Develops portions of presentations, publications, website postings, and applications in collaborations with other stakeholders.  Draws strategic and tactical conclusions from data analyses through summarization, interpretation, and visualization of data so to make recommendations to senior and executive leadership in an easy to understand communication format.  Provides data and analytic support, guidance, and education to both system office and individual ministry colleagues as needs arise.  Builds strong relationships internally and collaborates effectively on cross-functional teams.  Develops trusted relationships through efficient, high-quality execution of analyses and effective communication regarding expectations and timelines.  Responsible for leading a small number of projects that are narrow in scope and supporting portions of larger or more complex projects.  Provides technical guidance and direction to level I analysts and collaboratively works with Sr. analysts during consultations and presentations  Collaborates with members of various other departments (Supply Chain, Revenue, Finance, and Operational Excellence) to develop integrated ad hoc analyses aligned with the triple aim.  Works in partnership with Informatics and Data Governance and Warehouse in support of development and maintenance of data applications, clinical databases, and vendor systems housing clinical content providing feedback and input as requested.Minimum QualificationsMust possess a Master's degree with a background in Epidemiology, Computer Science, Statistics, Healthcare Administration, or related field with three (3) to five (5) years of progressively responsible operational or consulting experience in clinical care data and statistical analysis, or an equivalent combination of education and experience.Advanced Microsoft Office skills required particularly in Excel. Competent with statistical software systems such as SAS, R, Python, etc.  Experience with relational databases and Structural Query Language (SQL).  Experience with various data reporting and visualization software (Tableau, Qlikview, Business Objects, etc.).  Experience utilizing various quality improvement principles, theory, study design and statistical modeling and possess a continuous learner attitude.  Must possess excellent oral and written communication and presentation skills.  Must be well organized and possess the ability to work with minimal supervision, which includes setting ones own priorities and actively seeking direction in case of conflict.  Must be able to make decisions based on logical thinking and ethical principles.  Excellent interpersonal skills to foster collaborative partnerships using a team approach to span traditional boundaries within a health care setting.  Must be comfortable in a collaborative, shared leadership environment.  A personal presence that is characterized by a sense of honesty, integrity and caring with the ability to inspire and motivate others to promote the philosophy, mission, vision, goals and values of Trinity Health.Physical and Mental Requirements and Working ConditionsMust be able to set and organize ones own work priorities and adapt them when needed.  Must be able to travel to various sites, if required.  The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this classification. They are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of duties so assigned.
